3357 
3358 static int append_indent = 0; /* autoindent for first line */
3359 
3360 /*
3361  * ":insert" and ":append", also used by ":change"
3362  */
3363  void
3364 ex_append(exarg_T *eap)
3365 {
3366  char_u *theline;
3367  int did_undo = FALSE;
3368  linenr_T lnum = eap->line2;
3369  int indent = 0;
3370  char_u *p;
3371  int vcol;
3372  int empty = (curbuf->b_ml.ml_flags & ML_EMPTY);
3373 
3374  /* the ! flag toggles autoindent */
3375  if (eap->forceit)
3376  curbuf->b_p_ai = !curbuf->b_p_ai;
3377 
3378  /* First autoindent comes from the line we start on */
3379  if (eap->cmdidx != CMD_change && curbuf->b_p_ai && lnum > 0)
3380  append_indent = get_indent_lnum(lnum);
3381 
3382  if (eap->cmdidx != CMD_append)
3383  --lnum;
3384 
3385  /* when the buffer is empty need to delete the dummy line */
3386  if (empty && lnum == 1)
3387  lnum = 0;
3388 
3389  State = INSERT; /* behave like in Insert mode */
3390  if (curbuf->b_p_iminsert == B_IMODE_LMAP)
3391  State |= LANGMAP;
3392 
3393  for (;;)
3394  {
3395  msg_scroll = TRUE;
3396  need_wait_return = FALSE;
3397  if (curbuf->b_p_ai)
3398  {
3399  if (append_indent >= 0)
3400  {
3401  indent = append_indent;
3402  append_indent = -1;
3403  }
3404  else if (lnum > 0)
3405  indent = get_indent_lnum(lnum);
3406  }
3407  ex_keep_indent = FALSE;
3408  if (eap->getline == NULL)
3409  {
3410  /* No getline() function, use the lines that follow. This ends
3411  * when there is no more. */
3412  if (eap->nextcmd == NULL || *eap->nextcmd == NUL)
3413  break;
3414  p = vim_strchr(eap->nextcmd, NL);
3415  if (p == NULL)
3416  p = eap->nextcmd + STRLEN(eap->nextcmd);
3417  theline = vim_strnsave(eap->nextcmd, (int)(p - eap->nextcmd));
3418  if (*p != NUL)
3419  ++p;
3420  eap->nextcmd = p;
3421  }
3422  else
3423  {
3424  int save_State = State;
3425 
3426  /* Set State to avoid the cursor shape to be set to INSERT mode
3427  * when getline() returns. */
3428  State = CMDLINE;
3429  theline = eap->getline(
3430 #ifdef FEAT_EVAL
3431  eap->cstack->cs_looplevel > 0 ? -1 :
3432 #endif
3433  NUL, eap->cookie, indent, TRUE);
3434  State = save_State;
3435  }
3436  lines_left = Rows - 1;
3437  if (theline == NULL)
3438  break;
3439 
3440  /* Using ^ CTRL-D in getexmodeline() makes us repeat the indent. */
3441  if (ex_keep_indent)
3442  append_indent = indent;
3443 
3444  /* Look for the "." after automatic indent. */
3445  vcol = 0;
3446  for (p = theline; indent > vcol; ++p)
3447  {
3448  if (*p == ' ')
3449  ++vcol;
3450  else if (*p == TAB)
3451  vcol += 8 - vcol % 8;
3452  else
3453  break;
3454  }
3455  if ((p[0] == '.' && p[1] == NUL)
3456  || (!did_undo && u_save(lnum, lnum + 1 + (empty ? 1 : 0))
3457  == FAIL))
3458  {
3459  vim_free(theline);
3460  break;
3461  }
3462 
3463  /* don't use autoindent if nothing was typed. */
3464  if (p[0] == NUL)
3465  theline[0] = NUL;
3466 
3467  did_undo = TRUE;
3468  ml_append(lnum, theline, (colnr_T)0, FALSE);
3469  appended_lines_mark(lnum + (empty ? 1 : 0), 1L);
3470 
3471  vim_free(theline);
3472  ++lnum;
3473 
3474  if (empty)
3475  {
3476  ml_delete(2L, FALSE);
3477  empty = FALSE;
3478  }
3479  }
3480  State = NORMAL;
3481 
3482  if (eap->forceit)
3483  curbuf->b_p_ai = !curbuf->b_p_ai;
3484 
3485  /* "start" is set to eap->line2+1 unless that position is invalid (when
3486  * eap->line2 pointed to the end of the buffer and nothing was appended)
3487  * "end" is set to lnum when something has been appended, otherwise
3488  * it is the same than "start" -- Acevedo */
3489  curbuf->b_op_start.lnum = (eap->line2 < curbuf->b_ml.ml_line_count) ?
3490  eap->line2 + 1 : curbuf->b_ml.ml_line_count;
3491  if (eap->cmdidx != CMD_append)
3492  --curbuf->b_op_start.lnum;
3493  curbuf->b_op_end.lnum = (eap->line2 < lnum)
3494  ? lnum : curbuf->b_op_start.lnum;
3495  curbuf->b_op_start.col = curbuf->b_op_end.col = 0;
3496  curwin->w_cursor.lnum = lnum;
3497  check_cursor_lnum();
3498  beginline(BL_SOL | BL_FIX);
3499 
3500  need_wait_return = FALSE; /* don't use wait_return() now */
3501  ex_no_reprint = TRUE;
3502 }
3503 
3504 /*
3505  * ":change"
3506  */
3507  void
3508 ex_change(exarg_T *eap)
3509 {
3510  linenr_T lnum;
3511 
3512  if (eap->line2 >= eap->line1
3513  && u_save(eap->line1 - 1, eap->line2 + 1) == FAIL)
3514  return;
3515 
3516  /* the ! flag toggles autoindent */
3517  if (eap->forceit ? !curbuf->b_p_ai : curbuf->b_p_ai)
3518  append_indent = get_indent_lnum(eap->line1);
3519 
3520  for (lnum = eap->line2; lnum >= eap->line1; --lnum)
3521  {
3522  if (curbuf->b_ml.ml_flags & ML_EMPTY) /* nothing to delete */
3523  break;
3524  ml_delete(eap->line1, FALSE);
3525  }
3526 
3527  /* make sure the cursor is not beyond the end of the file now */
3528  check_cursor_lnum();
3529  deleted_lines_mark(eap->line1, (long)(eap->line2 - lnum));
3530 
3531  /* ":append" on the line above the deleted lines. */
3532  eap->line2 = eap->line1;
3533  ex_append(eap);
3534 }
3535 
3536  void
3537 ex_z(exarg_T *eap)
3538 {
3539  char_u *x;
3540  long bigness;
3541  char_u *kind;
3542  int minus = 0;
3543  linenr_T start, end, curs, i;
3544  int j;
3545  linenr_T lnum = eap->line2;
3546 
3547  /* Vi compatible: ":z!" uses display height, without a count uses
3548  * 'scroll' */
3549  if (eap->forceit)
3550  bigness = curwin->w_height;
3551  else if (!ONE_WINDOW)
3552  bigness = curwin->w_height - 3;
3553  else
3554  bigness = curwin->w_p_scr * 2;
3555  if (bigness < 1)
3556  bigness = 1;
3557 
3558  x = eap->arg;
3559  kind = x;
3560  if (*kind == '-' || *kind == '+' || *kind == '='
3561  || *kind == '^' || *kind == '.')
3562  ++x;
3563  while (*x == '-' || *x == '+')
3564  ++x;
3565 
3566  if (*x != 0)
3567  {
3568  if (!VIM_ISDIGIT(*x))
3569  {
3570  emsg(_("E144: non-numeric argument to :z"));
3571  return;
3572  }
3573  else
3574  {
3575  bigness = atol((char *)x);
3576 
3577  /* bigness could be < 0 if atol(x) overflows. */
3578  if (bigness > 2 * curbuf->b_ml.ml_line_count || bigness < 0)
3579  bigness = 2 * curbuf->b_ml.ml_line_count;
3580 
3581  p_window = bigness;
3582  if (*kind == '=')
3583  bigness += 2;
3584  }
3585  }
3586 
3587  /* the number of '-' and '+' multiplies the distance */
3588  if (*kind == '-' || *kind == '+')
3589  for (x = kind + 1; *x == *kind; ++x)
3590  ;
3591 
3592  switch (*kind)
3593  {
3594  case '-':
3595  start = lnum - bigness * (linenr_T)(x - kind) + 1;
3596  end = start + bigness - 1;
3597  curs = end;
3598  break;
3599 
3600  case '=':
3601  start = lnum - (bigness + 1) / 2 + 1;
3602  end = lnum + (bigness + 1) / 2 - 1;
3603  curs = lnum;
3604  minus = 1;
3605  break;
3606 
3607  case '^':
3608  start = lnum - bigness * 2;
3609  end = lnum - bigness;
3610  curs = lnum - bigness;
3611  break;
3612 
3613  case '.':
3614  start = lnum - (bigness + 1) / 2 + 1;
3615  end = lnum + (bigness + 1) / 2 - 1;
3616  curs = end;
3617  break;
3618 
3619  default: /* '+' */
3620  start = lnum;
3621  if (*kind == '+')
3622  start += bigness * (linenr_T)(x - kind - 1) + 1;
3623  else if (eap->addr_count == 0)
3624  ++start;
3625  end = start + bigness - 1;
3626  curs = end;
3627  break;
3628  }
3629 
3630  if (start < 1)
3631  start = 1;
3632 
3633  if (end > curbuf->b_ml.ml_line_count)
3634  end = curbuf->b_ml.ml_line_count;
3635 
3636  if (curs > curbuf->b_ml.ml_line_count)
3637  curs = curbuf->b_ml.ml_line_count;
3638  else if (curs < 1)
3639  curs = 1;
3640 
3641  for (i = start; i <= end; i++)
3642  {
3643  if (minus && i == lnum)
3644  {
3645  msg_putchar('\n');
3646 
3647  for (j = 1; j < Columns; j++)
3648  msg_putchar('-');
3649  }
3650 
3651  print_line(i, eap->flags & EXFLAG_NR, eap->flags & EXFLAG_LIST);
3652 
3653  if (minus && i == lnum)
3654  {
3655  msg_putchar('\n');
3656 
3657  for (j = 1; j < Columns; j++)
3658  msg_putchar('-');
3659  }
3660  }
3661 
3662  if (curwin->w_cursor.lnum != curs)
3663  {
3664  curwin->w_cursor.lnum = curs;
3665  curwin->w_cursor.col = 0;
3666  }
3667  ex_no_reprint = TRUE;
3668 }
3669 
3670 /*
3671  * Check if the restricted flag is set.
3672  * If so, give an error message and return TRUE.
3673  * Otherwise, return FALSE.
3674  */
3675  int
3676 check_restricted(void)
3677 {
3678  if (restricted)
3679  {
3680  emsg(_("E145: Shell commands and some functionality not allowed in rvim"));
3681  return TRUE;
3682  }
3683  return FALSE;
3684 }

3686 /*
3687  * Check if the secure flag is set (.exrc or .vimrc in current directory).
3688  * If so, give an error message and return TRUE.
3689  * Otherwise, return FALSE.
3690  */
3691  int
3692 check_secure(void)
3693 {
3694  if (secure)
3695  {
3696  secure = 2;
3697  emsg(_(e_curdir));
3698  return TRUE;
3699  }
3700 #ifdef HAVE_SANDBOX
3701  /*
3702  * In the sandbox more things are not allowed, including the things
3703  * disallowed in secure mode.
3704  */
3705  if (sandbox != 0)
3706  {
3707  emsg(_(e_sandbox));
3708  return TRUE;
3709  }
3710 #endif
3711  return FALSE;
3712 }
3713 
3714 static char_u *old_sub = NULL; /* previous substitute pattern */
3715 static int global_need_beginline; /* call beginline() after ":g" */
3716 
3717 /*
3718  * Flags that are kept between calls to :substitute.
3719  */
3720 typedef struct {
3721  int do_all; /* do multiple substitutions per line */
3722  int do_ask; /* ask for confirmation */
3723  int do_count; /* count only */
3724  int do_error; /* if false, ignore errors */
3725  int do_print; /* print last line with subs. */
3726  int do_list; /* list last line with subs. */
3727  int do_number; /* list last line with line nr*/
3728  int do_ic; /* ignore case flag */
3729 } subflags_T;
3730 
3731 /* do_sub()
3732  *
3733  * Perform a substitution from line eap->line1 to line eap->line2 using the
3734  * command pointed to by eap->arg which should be of the form:
3735  *
3736  * /pattern/substitution/{flags}
3737  *
3738  * The usual escapes are supported as described in the regexp docs.
3739  */
3740  void
3741 do_sub(exarg_T *eap)
3742 {
3743  linenr_T lnum;
3744  long i = 0;
3745  regmmatch_T regmatch;
3746  static subflags_T subflags = {FALSE, FALSE, FALSE, TRUE, FALSE,
3747  FALSE, FALSE, 0};
3748 #ifdef FEAT_EVAL
3749  subflags_T subflags_save;
3750 #endif
3751  int save_do_all; /* remember user specified 'g' flag */
3752  int save_do_ask; /* remember user specified 'c' flag */
3753  char_u *pat = NULL, *sub = NULL; /* init for GCC */
3754  int delimiter;
3755  int sublen;
3756  int got_quit = FALSE;
3757  int got_match = FALSE;
3758  int temp;
3759  int which_pat;
3760  char_u *cmd;
3761  int save_State;
3762  linenr_T first_line = 0; /* first changed line */
3763  linenr_T last_line= 0; /* below last changed line AFTER the
3764  * change */
3765  linenr_T old_line_count = curbuf->b_ml.ml_line_count;
3766  linenr_T line2;
3767  long nmatch; /* number of lines in match */
3768  char_u *sub_firstline; /* allocated copy of first sub line */
3769  int endcolumn = FALSE; /* cursor in last column when done */
3770  pos_T old_cursor = curwin->w_cursor;
3771  int start_nsubs;
3772 #ifdef FEAT_EVAL
3773  int save_ma = 0;
3774 #endif
3775 
3776  cmd = eap->arg;
3777  if (!global_busy)
3778  {
3779  sub_nsubs = 0;
3780  sub_nlines = 0;
3781  }
3782  start_nsubs = sub_nsubs;
3783 
3784  if (eap->cmdidx == CMD_tilde)
3785  which_pat = RE_LAST; /* use last used regexp */
3786  else
3787  which_pat = RE_SUBST; /* use last substitute regexp */
3788 
3789  /* new pattern and substitution */
3790  if (eap->cmd[0] == 's' && *cmd != NUL && !VIM_ISWHITE(*cmd)
3791  && vim_strchr((char_u *)"0123456789cegriIp|\"", *cmd) == NULL)
3792  {
3793  /* don't accept alphanumeric for separator */
3794  if (isalpha(*cmd))
3795  {
3796  emsg(_("E146: Regular expressions can't be delimited by letters"));
3797  return;
3798  }
3799  /*
3800  * undocumented vi feature:
3801  * "\/sub/" and "\?sub?" use last used search pattern (almost like
3802  * //sub/r). "\&sub&" use last substitute pattern (like //sub/).
3803  */
3804  if (*cmd == '\\')
3805  {
3806  ++cmd;
3807  if (vim_strchr((char_u *)"/?&", *cmd) == NULL)
3808  {
3809  emsg(_(e_backslash));
3810  return;
3811  }
3812  if (*cmd != '&')
3813  which_pat = RE_SEARCH; /* use last '/' pattern */
3814  pat = (char_u *)""; /* empty search pattern */
3815  delimiter = *cmd++; /* remember delimiter character */
3816  }
3817  else /* find the end of the regexp */
3818  {
3819  which_pat = RE_LAST; /* use last used regexp */
3820  delimiter = *cmd++; /* remember delimiter character */
3821  pat = cmd; /* remember start of search pat */
3822  cmd = skip_regexp(cmd, delimiter, p_magic, &eap->arg);
3823  if (cmd[0] == delimiter) /* end delimiter found */
3824  *cmd++ = NUL; /* replace it with a NUL */
3825  }
3826 
3827  /*
3828  * Small incompatibility: vi sees '\n' as end of the command, but in
3829  * Vim we want to use '\n' to find/substitute a NUL.
3830  */
3831  sub = cmd; /* remember the start of the substitution */
3832 
3833  while (cmd[0])
3834  {
3835  if (cmd[0] == delimiter) /* end delimiter found */
3836  {
3837  *cmd++ = NUL; /* replace it with a NUL */
3838  break;
3839  }
3840  if (cmd[0] == '\\' && cmd[1] != 0) /* skip escaped characters */
3841  ++cmd;
3842  MB_PTR_ADV(cmd);
3843  }
3844 
3845  if (!eap->skip)
3846  {
3847  /* In POSIX vi ":s/pat/%/" uses the previous subst. string. */
3848  if (STRCMP(sub, "%") == 0
3849  && vim_strchr(p_cpo, CPO_SUBPERCENT) != NULL)
3850  {
3851  if (old_sub == NULL) /* there is no previous command */
3852  {
3853  emsg(_(e_nopresub));
3854  return;
3855  }
3856  sub = old_sub;
3857  }
3858  else
3859  {
3860  vim_free(old_sub);
3861  old_sub = vim_strsave(sub);
3862  }
3863  }
3864  }
3865  else if (!eap->skip) /* use previous pattern and substitution */
3866  {
3867  if (old_sub == NULL) /* there is no previous command */
3868  {
3869  emsg(_(e_nopresub));
3870  return;
3871  }
3872  pat = NULL; /* search_regcomp() will use previous pattern */
3873  sub = old_sub;
3874 
3875  /* Vi compatibility quirk: repeating with ":s" keeps the cursor in the
3876  * last column after using "$". */
3877  endcolumn = (curwin->w_curswant == MAXCOL);
3878  }
3879 
3880  /* Recognize ":%s/\n//" and turn it into a join command, which is much
3881  * more efficient.
3882  * TODO: find a generic solution to make line-joining operations more
3883  * efficient, avoid allocating a string that grows in size.
3884  */
3885  if (pat != NULL && STRCMP(pat, "\\n") == 0
3886  && *sub == NUL
3887  && (*cmd == NUL || (cmd[1] == NUL && (*cmd == 'g' || *cmd == 'l'
3888  || *cmd == 'p' || *cmd == '#'))))
3889  {
3890  linenr_T joined_lines_count;
3891 
3892  curwin->w_cursor.lnum = eap->line1;
3893  if (*cmd == 'l')
3894  eap->flags = EXFLAG_LIST;
3895  else if (*cmd == '#')
3896  eap->flags = EXFLAG_NR;
3897  else if (*cmd == 'p')
3898  eap->flags = EXFLAG_PRINT;
3899 
3900  /* The number of lines joined is the number of lines in the range plus
3901  * one. One less when the last line is included. */
3902  joined_lines_count = eap->line2 - eap->line1 + 1;
3903  if (eap->line2 < curbuf->b_ml.ml_line_count)
3904  ++joined_lines_count;
3905  if (joined_lines_count > 1)
3906  {
3907  (void)do_join(joined_lines_count, FALSE, TRUE, FALSE, TRUE);
3908  sub_nsubs = joined_lines_count - 1;
3909  sub_nlines = 1;
3910  (void)do_sub_msg(FALSE);
3911  ex_may_print(eap);
3912  }
3913 
3914  if (!cmdmod.keeppatterns)
3915  save_re_pat(RE_SUBST, pat, p_magic);
3916  // put pattern in history
3917  add_to_history(HIST_SEARCH, pat, TRUE, NUL);
3918 
3919  return;
3920  }
3921 
3922  /*
3923  * Find trailing options. When '&' is used, keep old options.
3924  */
3925  if (*cmd == '&')
3926  ++cmd;
3927  else
3928  {
3929  if (!p_ed)
3930  {
3931  if (p_gd) /* default is global on */
3932  subflags.do_all = TRUE;
3933  else
3934  subflags.do_all = FALSE;
3935  subflags.do_ask = FALSE;
3936  }
3937  subflags.do_error = TRUE;
3938  subflags.do_print = FALSE;
3939  subflags.do_list = FALSE;
3940  subflags.do_count = FALSE;
3941  subflags.do_number = FALSE;
3942  subflags.do_ic = 0;
3943  }
3944  while (*cmd)
3945  {
3946  /*
3947  * Note that 'g' and 'c' are always inverted, also when p_ed is off.
3948  * 'r' is never inverted.
3949  */
3950  if (*cmd == 'g')
3951  subflags.do_all = !subflags.do_all;
3952  else if (*cmd == 'c')
3953  subflags.do_ask = !subflags.do_ask;
3954  else if (*cmd == 'n')
3955  subflags.do_count = TRUE;
3956  else if (*cmd == 'e')
3957  subflags.do_error = !subflags.do_error;
3958  else if (*cmd == 'r') /* use last used regexp */
3959  which_pat = RE_LAST;
3960  else if (*cmd == 'p')
3961  subflags.do_print = TRUE;
3962  else if (*cmd == '#')
3963  {
3964  subflags.do_print = TRUE;
3965  subflags.do_number = TRUE;
3966  }
3967  else if (*cmd == 'l')
3968  {
3969  subflags.do_print = TRUE;
3970  subflags.do_list = TRUE;
3971  }
3972  else if (*cmd == 'i') /* ignore case */
3973  subflags.do_ic = 'i';
3974  else if (*cmd == 'I') /* don't ignore case */
3975  subflags.do_ic = 'I';
3976  else
3977  break;
3978  ++cmd;
3979  }
3980  if (subflags.do_count)
3981  subflags.do_ask = FALSE;
3982 
3983  save_do_all = subflags.do_all;
3984  save_do_ask = subflags.do_ask;
3985 
3986  /*
3987  * check for a trailing count
3988  */
3989  cmd = skipwhite(cmd);
3990  if (VIM_ISDIGIT(*cmd))
3991  {
3992  i = getdigits(&cmd);
3993  if (i <= 0 && !eap->skip && subflags.do_error)
3994  {
3995  emsg(_(e_zerocount));
3996  return;
3997  }
3998  eap->line1 = eap->line2;
3999  eap->line2 += i - 1;
4000  if (eap->line2 > curbuf->b_ml.ml_line_count)
4001  eap->line2 = curbuf->b_ml.ml_line_count;
4002  }
4003 
4004  /*
4005  * check for trailing command or garbage
4006  */
4007  cmd = skipwhite(cmd);
4008  if (*cmd && *cmd != '"') /* if not end-of-line or comment */
4009  {
4010  eap->nextcmd = check_nextcmd(cmd);
4011  if (eap->nextcmd == NULL)
4012  {
4013  emsg(_(e_trailing));
4014  return;
4015  }
4016  }
4017 
4018  if (eap->skip) /* not executing commands, only parsing */
4019  return;
4020 
4021  if (!subflags.do_count && !curbuf->b_p_ma)
4022  {
4023  /* Substitution is not allowed in non-'modifiable' buffer */
4024  emsg(_(e_modifiable));
4025  return;
4026  }
4027 
4028  if (search_regcomp(pat, RE_SUBST, which_pat, SEARCH_HIS, &regmatch) == FAIL)
4029  {
4030  if (subflags.do_error)
4031  emsg(_(e_invcmd));
4032  return;
4033  }
4034 
4035  /* the 'i' or 'I' flag overrules 'ignorecase' and 'smartcase' */
4036  if (subflags.do_ic == 'i')
4037  regmatch.rmm_ic = TRUE;
4038  else if (subflags.do_ic == 'I')
4039  regmatch.rmm_ic = FALSE;
4040 
4041  sub_firstline = NULL;
4042 
4043  /*
4044  * ~ in the substitute pattern is replaced with the old pattern.
4045  * We do it here once to avoid it to be replaced over and over again.
4046  * But don't do it when it starts with "\=", then it's an expression.
4047  */
4048  if (!(sub[0] == '\\' && sub[1] == '='))
4049  sub = regtilde(sub, p_magic);
4050 
4051  /*
4052  * Check for a match on each line.
4053  */
4054  line2 = eap->line2;
4055  for (lnum = eap->line1; lnum <= line2 && !(got_quit
4056 #if defined(FEAT_EVAL)
4057  || aborting()
4058 #endif
4059  ); ++lnum)
4060  {
4061  nmatch = vim_regexec_multi(&regmatch, curwin, curbuf, lnum,
4062  (colnr_T)0, NULL, NULL);
4063  if (nmatch)
4064  {
4065  colnr_T copycol;
4066  colnr_T matchcol;
4067  colnr_T prev_matchcol = MAXCOL;
4068  char_u *new_end, *new_start = NULL;
4069  unsigned new_start_len = 0;
4070  char_u *p1;
4071  int did_sub = FALSE;
4072  int lastone;
4073  int len, copy_len, needed_len;
4074  long nmatch_tl = 0; /* nr of lines matched below lnum */
4075  int do_again; /* do it again after joining lines */
4076  int skip_match = FALSE;
4077  linenr_T sub_firstlnum; /* nr of first sub line */
4078 #ifdef FEAT_TEXT_PROP
4079  int apc_flags = APC_SAVE_FOR_UNDO | APC_SUBSTITUTE;
4080 #endif
4081 
4082  /*
4083  * The new text is build up step by step, to avoid too much
4084  * copying. There are these pieces:
4085  * sub_firstline The old text, unmodified.
4086  * copycol Column in the old text where we started
4087  * looking for a match; from here old text still
4088  * needs to be copied to the new text.
4089  * matchcol Column number of the old text where to look
4090  * for the next match. It's just after the
4091  * previous match or one further.
4092  * prev_matchcol Column just after the previous match (if any).
4093  * Mostly equal to matchcol, except for the first
4094  * match and after skipping an empty match.
4095  * regmatch.*pos Where the pattern matched in the old text.
4096  * new_start The new text, all that has been produced so
4097  * far.
4098  * new_end The new text, where to append new text.
4099  *
4100  * lnum The line number where we found the start of
4101  * the match. Can be below the line we searched
4102  * when there is a \n before a \zs in the
4103  * pattern.
4104  * sub_firstlnum The line number in the buffer where to look
4105  * for a match. Can be different from "lnum"
4106  * when the pattern or substitute string contains
4107  * line breaks.
4108  *
4109  * Special situations:
4110  * - When the substitute string contains a line break, the part up
4111  * to the line break is inserted in the text, but the copy of
4112  * the original line is kept. "sub_firstlnum" is adjusted for
4113  * the inserted lines.
4114  * - When the matched pattern contains a line break, the old line
4115  * is taken from the line at the end of the pattern. The lines
4116  * in the match are deleted later, "sub_firstlnum" is adjusted
4117  * accordingly.
4118  *
4119  * The new text is built up in new_start[]. It has some extra
4120  * room to avoid using alloc()/free() too often. new_start_len is
4121  * the length of the allocated memory at new_start.
4122  *
4123  * Make a copy of the old line, so it won't be taken away when
4124  * updating the screen or handling a multi-line match. The "old_"
4125  * pointers point into this copy.
4126  */
4127  sub_firstlnum = lnum;
4128  copycol = 0;
4129  matchcol = 0;
4130 
4131  /* At first match, remember current cursor position. */
4132  if (!got_match)
4133  {
4134  setpcmark();
4135  got_match = TRUE;
4136  }
4137 
4138  /*
4139  * Loop until nothing more to replace in this line.
4140  * 1. Handle match with empty string.
4141  * 2. If do_ask is set, ask for confirmation.
4142  * 3. substitute the string.
4143  * 4. if do_all is set, find next match
4144  * 5. break if there isn't another match in this line
4145  */
4146  for (;;)
4147  {
4148  /* Advance "lnum" to the line where the match starts. The
4149  * match does not start in the first line when there is a line
4150  * break before \zs. */
4151  if (regmatch.startpos[0].lnum > 0)
4152  {
4153  lnum += regmatch.startpos[0].lnum;
4154  sub_firstlnum += regmatch.startpos[0].lnum;
4155  nmatch -= regmatch.startpos[0].lnum;
4156  VIM_CLEAR(sub_firstline);
4157  }
4158 
4159  if (sub_firstline == NULL)
4160  {
4161  sub_firstline = vim_strsave(ml_get(sub_firstlnum));
4162  if (sub_firstline == NULL)
4163  {
4164  vim_free(new_start);
4165  goto outofmem;
4166  }
4167  }
4168 
4169  /* Save the line number of the last change for the final
4170  * cursor position (just like Vi). */
4171  curwin->w_cursor.lnum = lnum;
4172  do_again = FALSE;
4173 
4174  /*
4175  * 1. Match empty string does not count, except for first
4176  * match. This reproduces the strange vi behaviour.
4177  * This also catches endless loops.
4178  */
4179  if (matchcol == prev_matchcol
4180  && regmatch.endpos[0].lnum == 0
4181  && matchcol == regmatch.endpos[0].col)
4182  {
4183  if (sub_firstline[matchcol] == NUL)
4184  /* We already were at the end of the line. Don't look
4185  * for a match in this line again. */
4186  skip_match = TRUE;
4187  else
4188  {
4189  /* search for a match at next column */
4190  if (has_mbyte)
4191  matchcol += mb_ptr2len(sub_firstline + matchcol);
4192  else
4193  ++matchcol;
4194  }
4195  goto skip;
4196  }
4197 
4198  /* Normally we continue searching for a match just after the
4199  * previous match. */
4200  matchcol = regmatch.endpos[0].col;
4201  prev_matchcol = matchcol;
4202 
4203  /*
4204  * 2. If do_count is set only increase the counter.
4205  * If do_ask is set, ask for confirmation.
4206  */
4207  if (subflags.do_count)
4208  {
4209  /* For a multi-line match, put matchcol at the NUL at
4210  * the end of the line and set nmatch to one, so that
4211  * we continue looking for a match on the next line.
4212  * Avoids that ":s/\nB\@=//gc" get stuck. */
4213  if (nmatch > 1)
4214  {
4215  matchcol = (colnr_T)STRLEN(sub_firstline);
4216  nmatch = 1;
4217  skip_match = TRUE;
4218  }
4219  sub_nsubs++;
4220  did_sub = TRUE;
4221 #ifdef FEAT_EVAL
4222  /* Skip the substitution, unless an expression is used,
4223  * then it is evaluated in the sandbox. */
4224  if (!(sub[0] == '\\' && sub[1] == '='))
4225 #endif
4226  goto skip;
4227  }
4228 
4229  if (subflags.do_ask)
4230  {
4231  int typed = 0;
4232 
4233  /* change State to CONFIRM, so that the mouse works
4234  * properly */
4235  save_State = State;
4236  State = CONFIRM;
4237  setmouse(); // disable mouse in xterm
4238  curwin->w_cursor.col = regmatch.startpos[0].col;
4239  if (curwin->w_p_crb)
4240  do_check_cursorbind();
4241 
4242  /* When 'cpoptions' contains "u" don't sync undo when
4243  * asking for confirmation. */
4244  if (vim_strchr(p_cpo, CPO_UNDO) != NULL)
4245  ++no_u_sync;
4246 
4247  /*
4248  * Loop until 'y', 'n', 'q', CTRL-E or CTRL-Y typed.
4249  */
4250  while (subflags.do_ask)
4251  {
4252  if (exmode_active)
4253  {
4254  char_u *resp;
4255  colnr_T sc, ec;
4256 
4257  print_line_no_prefix(lnum,
4258  subflags.do_number, subflags.do_list);
4259 
4260  getvcol(curwin, &curwin->w_cursor, &sc, NULL, NULL);
4261  curwin->w_cursor.col = regmatch.endpos[0].col - 1;
4262  if (curwin->w_cursor.col < 0)
4263  curwin->w_cursor.col = 0;
4264  getvcol(curwin, &curwin->w_cursor, NULL, NULL, &ec);
4265  if (subflags.do_number || curwin->w_p_nu)
4266  {
4267  int numw = number_width(curwin) + 1;
4268  sc += numw;
4269  ec += numw;
4270  }
4271  msg_start();
4272  for (i = 0; i < (long)sc; ++i)
4273  msg_putchar(' ');
4274  for ( ; i <= (long)ec; ++i)
4275  msg_putchar('^');
4276 
4277  resp = getexmodeline('?', NULL, 0, TRUE);
4278  if (resp != NULL)
4279  {
4280  typed = *resp;
4281  vim_free(resp);
4282  }
4283  }
4284  else
4285  {
4286  char_u *orig_line = NULL;
4287  int len_change = 0;
4288 #ifdef FEAT_FOLDING
4289  int save_p_fen = curwin->w_p_fen;
4290 
4291  curwin->w_p_fen = FALSE;
4292 #endif
4293  /* Invert the matched string.
4294  * Remove the inversion afterwards. */
4295  temp = RedrawingDisabled;
4296  RedrawingDisabled = 0;
4297 
4298  if (new_start != NULL)
4299  {
4300  /* There already was a substitution, we would
4301  * like to show this to the user. We cannot
4302  * really update the line, it would change
4303  * what matches. Temporarily replace the line
4304  * and change it back afterwards. */
4305  orig_line = vim_strsave(ml_get(lnum));
4306  if (orig_line != NULL)
4307  {
4308  char_u *new_line = concat_str(new_start,
4309  sub_firstline + copycol);
4310 
4311  if (new_line == NULL)
4312  VIM_CLEAR(orig_line);
4313  else
4314  {
4315  /* Position the cursor relative to the
4316  * end of the line, the previous
4317  * substitute may have inserted or
4318  * deleted characters before the
4319  * cursor. */
4320  len_change = (int)STRLEN(new_line)
4321  - (int)STRLEN(orig_line);
4322  curwin->w_cursor.col += len_change;
4323  ml_replace(lnum, new_line, FALSE);
4324  }
4325  }
4326  }
4327 
4328  search_match_lines = regmatch.endpos[0].lnum
4329  - regmatch.startpos[0].lnum;
4330  search_match_endcol = regmatch.endpos[0].col
4331  + len_change;
4332  highlight_match = TRUE;
4333 
4334  update_topline();
4335  validate_cursor();
4336  update_screen(SOME_VALID);
4337  highlight_match = FALSE;
4338  redraw_later(SOME_VALID);
4339 
4340 #ifdef FEAT_FOLDING
4341  curwin->w_p_fen = save_p_fen;
4342 #endif
4343  if (msg_row == Rows - 1)
4344  msg_didout = FALSE; /* avoid a scroll-up */
4345  msg_starthere();
4346  i = msg_scroll;
4347  msg_scroll = 0; /* truncate msg when
4348  needed */
4349  msg_no_more = TRUE;
4350  /* write message same highlighting as for
4351  * wait_return */
4352  smsg_attr(HL_ATTR(HLF_R),
4353  _("replace with %s (y/n/a/q/l/^E/^Y)?"), sub);
4354  msg_no_more = FALSE;
4355  msg_scroll = i;
4356  showruler(TRUE);
4357  windgoto(msg_row, msg_col);
4358  RedrawingDisabled = temp;
4359 
4360 #ifdef USE_ON_FLY_SCROLL
4361  dont_scroll = FALSE; /* allow scrolling here */
4362 #endif
4363  ++no_mapping; /* don't map this key */
4364  ++allow_keys; /* allow special keys */
4365  typed = plain_vgetc();
4366  --allow_keys;
4367  --no_mapping;
4368 
4369  /* clear the question */
4370  msg_didout = FALSE; /* don't scroll up */
4371  msg_col = 0;
4372  gotocmdline(TRUE);
4373 
4374  /* restore the line */
4375  if (orig_line != NULL)
4376  ml_replace(lnum, orig_line, FALSE);
4377  }
4378 
4379  need_wait_return = FALSE; /* no hit-return prompt */
4380  if (typed == 'q' || typed == ESC || typed == Ctrl_C
4381 #ifdef UNIX
4382  || typed == intr_char
4383 #endif
4384  )
4385  {
4386  got_quit = TRUE;
4387  break;
4388  }
4389  if (typed == 'n')
4390  break;
4391  if (typed == 'y')
4392  break;
4393  if (typed == 'l')
4394  {
4395  /* last: replace and then stop */
4396  subflags.do_all = FALSE;
4397  line2 = lnum;
4398  break;
4399  }
4400  if (typed == 'a')
4401  {
4402  subflags.do_ask = FALSE;
4403  break;
4404  }
4405  if (typed == Ctrl_E)
4406  scrollup_clamp();
4407  else if (typed == Ctrl_Y)
4408  scrolldown_clamp();
4409  }
4410  State = save_State;
4411  setmouse();
4412  if (vim_strchr(p_cpo, CPO_UNDO) != NULL)
4413  --no_u_sync;
4414 
4415  if (typed == 'n')
4416  {
4417  /* For a multi-line match, put matchcol at the NUL at
4418  * the end of the line and set nmatch to one, so that
4419  * we continue looking for a match on the next line.
4420  * Avoids that ":%s/\nB\@=//gc" and ":%s/\n/,\r/gc"
4421  * get stuck when pressing 'n'. */
4422  if (nmatch > 1)
4423  {
4424  matchcol = (colnr_T)STRLEN(sub_firstline);
4425  skip_match = TRUE;
4426  }
4427  goto skip;
4428  }
4429  if (got_quit)
4430  goto skip;
4431  }
4432 
4433  /* Move the cursor to the start of the match, so that we can
4434  * use "\=col("."). */
4435  curwin->w_cursor.col = regmatch.startpos[0].col;
4436 
4437  /*
4438  * 3. substitute the string.
4439  */
4440 #ifdef FEAT_EVAL
4441  save_ma = curbuf->b_p_ma;
4442  if (subflags.do_count)
4443  {
4444  // prevent accidentally changing the buffer by a function
4445  curbuf->b_p_ma = FALSE;
4446  sandbox++;
4447  }
4448  // Save flags for recursion. They can change for e.g.
4449  // :s/^/\=execute("s#^##gn")
4450  subflags_save = subflags;
4451 #endif
4452  // get length of substitution part
4453  sublen = vim_regsub_multi(&regmatch,
4454  sub_firstlnum - regmatch.startpos[0].lnum,
4455  sub, sub_firstline, FALSE, p_magic, TRUE);
4456 #ifdef FEAT_EVAL
4457  // If getting the substitute string caused an error, don't do
4458  // the replacement.
4459  // Don't keep flags set by a recursive call.
4460  subflags = subflags_save;
4461  if (aborting() || subflags.do_count)
4462  {
4463  curbuf->b_p_ma = save_ma;
4464  if (sandbox > 0)
4465  sandbox--;
4466  goto skip;
4467  }
4468 #endif
4469 
4470  /* When the match included the "$" of the last line it may
4471  * go beyond the last line of the buffer. */
4472  if (nmatch > curbuf->b_ml.ml_line_count - sub_firstlnum + 1)
4473  {
4474  nmatch = curbuf->b_ml.ml_line_count - sub_firstlnum + 1;
4475  skip_match = TRUE;
4476  }
4477 
4478  /* Need room for:
4479  * - result so far in new_start (not for first sub in line)
4480  * - original text up to match
4481  * - length of substituted part
4482  * - original text after match
4483  * Adjust text properties here, since we have all information
4484  * needed.
4485  */
4486  if (nmatch == 1)
4487  {
4488  p1 = sub_firstline;
4489 #ifdef FEAT_TEXT_PROP
4490  if (curbuf->b_has_textprop)
4491  {
4492  // When text properties are changed, need to save for
4493  // undo first, unless done already.
4494  if (adjust_prop_columns(lnum, regmatch.startpos[0].col,
4495  sublen - 1 - (regmatch.endpos[0].col
4496  - regmatch.startpos[0].col),
4497  apc_flags))
4498  apc_flags &= ~APC_SAVE_FOR_UNDO;
4499  }
4500 #endif
4501  }
4502  else
4503  {
4504  p1 = ml_get(sub_firstlnum + nmatch - 1);
4505  nmatch_tl += nmatch - 1;
4506  }
4507  copy_len = regmatch.startpos[0].col - copycol;
4508  needed_len = copy_len + ((unsigned)STRLEN(p1)
4509  - regmatch.endpos[0].col) + sublen + 1;
4510  if (new_start == NULL)
4511  {
4512  /*
4513  * Get some space for a temporary buffer to do the
4514  * substitution into (and some extra space to avoid
4515  * too many calls to alloc()/free()).
4516  */
4517  new_start_len = needed_len + 50;
4518  if ((new_start = alloc(new_start_len)) == NULL)
4519  goto outofmem;
4520  *new_start = NUL;
4521  new_end = new_start;
4522  }
4523  else
4524  {
4525  /*
4526  * Check if the temporary buffer is long enough to do the
4527  * substitution into. If not, make it larger (with a bit
4528  * extra to avoid too many calls to alloc()/free()).
4529  */
4530  len = (unsigned)STRLEN(new_start);
4531  needed_len += len;
4532  if (needed_len > (int)new_start_len)
4533  {
4534  new_start_len = needed_len + 50;
4535  if ((p1 = alloc(new_start_len)) == NULL)
4536  {
4537  vim_free(new_start);
4538  goto outofmem;
4539  }
4540  mch_memmove(p1, new_start, (size_t)(len + 1));
4541  vim_free(new_start);
4542  new_start = p1;
4543  }
4544  new_end = new_start + len;
4545  }
4546 
4547  /*
4548  * copy the text up to the part that matched
4549  */
4550  mch_memmove(new_end, sub_firstline + copycol, (size_t)copy_len);
4551  new_end += copy_len;
4552 
4553  (void)vim_regsub_multi(&regmatch,
4554  sub_firstlnum - regmatch.startpos[0].lnum,
4555  sub, new_end, TRUE, p_magic, TRUE);
4556  sub_nsubs++;
4557  did_sub = TRUE;
4558 
4559  /* Move the cursor to the start of the line, to avoid that it
4560  * is beyond the end of the line after the substitution. */
4561  curwin->w_cursor.col = 0;
4562 
4563  /* For a multi-line match, make a copy of the last matched
4564  * line and continue in that one. */
4565  if (nmatch > 1)
4566  {
4567  sub_firstlnum += nmatch - 1;
4568  vim_free(sub_firstline);
4569  sub_firstline = vim_strsave(ml_get(sub_firstlnum));
4570  /* When going beyond the last line, stop substituting. */
4571  if (sub_firstlnum <= line2)
4572  do_again = TRUE;
4573  else
4574  subflags.do_all = FALSE;
4575  }
4576 
4577  /* Remember next character to be copied. */
4578  copycol = regmatch.endpos[0].col;
4579 
4580  if (skip_match)
4581  {
4582  /* Already hit end of the buffer, sub_firstlnum is one
4583  * less than what it ought to be. */
4584  vim_free(sub_firstline);
4585  sub_firstline = vim_strsave((char_u *)"");
4586  copycol = 0;
4587  }
4588 
4589  /*
4590  * Now the trick is to replace CTRL-M chars with a real line
4591  * break. This would make it impossible to insert a CTRL-M in
4592  * the text. The line break can be avoided by preceding the
4593  * CTRL-M with a backslash. To be able to insert a backslash,
4594  * they must be doubled in the string and are halved here.
4595  * That is Vi compatible.
4596  */
4597  for (p1 = new_end; *p1; ++p1)
4598  {
4599  if (p1[0] == '\\' && p1[1] != NUL) /* remove backslash */
4600  {
4601  STRMOVE(p1, p1 + 1);
4602 #ifdef FEAT_TEXT_PROP
4603  if (curbuf->b_has_textprop)
4604  {
4605  // When text properties are changed, need to save
4606  // for undo first, unless done already.
4607  if (adjust_prop_columns(lnum,
4608  (colnr_T)(p1 - new_start), -1,
4609  apc_flags))
4610  apc_flags &= ~APC_SAVE_FOR_UNDO;
4611  }
4612 #endif
4613  }
4614  else if (*p1 == CAR)
4615  {
4616  if (u_inssub(lnum) == OK) // prepare for undo
4617  {
4618  colnr_T plen = (colnr_T)(p1 - new_start + 1);
4619 
4620  *p1 = NUL; // truncate up to the CR
4621  ml_append(lnum - 1, new_start, plen, FALSE);
4622  mark_adjust(lnum + 1, (linenr_T)MAXLNUM, 1L, 0L);
4623  if (subflags.do_ask)
4624  appended_lines(lnum - 1, 1L);
4625  else
4626  {
4627  if (first_line == 0)
4628  first_line = lnum;
4629  last_line = lnum + 1;
4630  }
4631 #ifdef FEAT_TEXT_PROP
4632  adjust_props_for_split(lnum + 1, lnum, plen, 1);
4633 #endif
4634  // all line numbers increase
4635  ++sub_firstlnum;
4636  ++lnum;
4637  ++line2;
4638  // move the cursor to the new line, like Vi
4639  ++curwin->w_cursor.lnum;
4640  // copy the rest
4641  STRMOVE(new_start, p1 + 1);
4642  p1 = new_start - 1;
4643  }
4644  }
4645  else if (has_mbyte)
4646  p1 += (*mb_ptr2len)(p1) - 1;
4647  }
4648 
4649  /*
4650  * 4. If do_all is set, find next match.
4651  * Prevent endless loop with patterns that match empty
4652  * strings, e.g. :s/$/pat/g or :s/[a-z]* /(&)/g.
4653  * But ":s/\n/#/" is OK.
4654  */
4655 skip:
4656  /* We already know that we did the last subst when we are at
4657  * the end of the line, except that a pattern like
4658  * "bar\|\nfoo" may match at the NUL. "lnum" can be below
4659  * "line2" when there is a \zs in the pattern after a line
4660  * break. */
4661  lastone = (skip_match
4662  || got_int
4663  || got_quit
4664  || lnum > line2
4665  || !(subflags.do_all || do_again)
4666  || (sub_firstline[matchcol] == NUL && nmatch <= 1
4667  && !re_multiline(regmatch.regprog)));
4668  nmatch = -1;
4669 
4670  /*
4671  * Replace the line in the buffer when needed. This is
4672  * skipped when there are more matches.
4673  * The check for nmatch_tl is needed for when multi-line
4674  * matching must replace the lines before trying to do another
4675  * match, otherwise "\@<=" won't work.
4676  * When the match starts below where we start searching also
4677  * need to replace the line first (using \zs after \n).
4678  */
4679  if (lastone
4680  || nmatch_tl > 0
4681  || (nmatch = vim_regexec_multi(&regmatch, curwin,
4682  curbuf, sub_firstlnum,
4683  matchcol, NULL, NULL)) == 0
4684  || regmatch.startpos[0].lnum > 0)
4685  {
4686  if (new_start != NULL)
4687  {
4688  /*
4689  * Copy the rest of the line, that didn't match.
4690  * "matchcol" has to be adjusted, we use the end of
4691  * the line as reference, because the substitute may
4692  * have changed the number of characters. Same for
4693  * "prev_matchcol".
4694  */
4695  STRCAT(new_start, sub_firstline + copycol);
4696  matchcol = (colnr_T)STRLEN(sub_firstline) - matchcol;
4697  prev_matchcol = (colnr_T)STRLEN(sub_firstline)
4698  - prev_matchcol;
4699 
4700  if (u_savesub(lnum) != OK)
4701  break;
4702  ml_replace(lnum, new_start, TRUE);
4703 
4704  if (nmatch_tl > 0)
4705  {
4706  /*
4707  * Matched lines have now been substituted and are
4708  * useless, delete them. The part after the match
4709  * has been appended to new_start, we don't need
4710  * it in the buffer.
4711  */
4712  ++lnum;
4713  if (u_savedel(lnum, nmatch_tl) != OK)
4714  break;
4715  for (i = 0; i < nmatch_tl; ++i)
4716  ml_delete(lnum, (int)FALSE);
4717  mark_adjust(lnum, lnum + nmatch_tl - 1,
4718  (long)MAXLNUM, -nmatch_tl);
4719  if (subflags.do_ask)
4720  deleted_lines(lnum, nmatch_tl);
4721  --lnum;
4722  line2 -= nmatch_tl; /* nr of lines decreases */
4723  nmatch_tl = 0;
4724  }
4725 
4726  /* When asking, undo is saved each time, must also set
4727  * changed flag each time. */
4728  if (subflags.do_ask)
4729  changed_bytes(lnum, 0);
4730  else
4731  {
4732  if (first_line == 0)
4733  first_line = lnum;
4734  last_line = lnum + 1;
4735  }
4736 
4737  sub_firstlnum = lnum;
4738  vim_free(sub_firstline); /* free the temp buffer */
4739  sub_firstline = new_start;
4740  new_start = NULL;
4741  matchcol = (colnr_T)STRLEN(sub_firstline) - matchcol;
4742  prev_matchcol = (colnr_T)STRLEN(sub_firstline)
4743  - prev_matchcol;
4744  copycol = 0;
4745  }
4746  if (nmatch == -1 && !lastone)
4747  nmatch = vim_regexec_multi(&regmatch, curwin, curbuf,
4748  sub_firstlnum, matchcol, NULL, NULL);
4749 
4750  /*
4751  * 5. break if there isn't another match in this line
4752  */
4753  if (nmatch <= 0)
4754  {
4755  /* If the match found didn't start where we were
4756  * searching, do the next search in the line where we
4757  * found the match. */
4758  if (nmatch == -1)
4759  lnum -= regmatch.startpos[0].lnum;
4760  break;
4761  }
4762  }
4763 
4764  line_breakcheck();
4765  }
4766 
4767  if (did_sub)
4768  ++sub_nlines;
4769  vim_free(new_start); /* for when substitute was cancelled */
4770  VIM_CLEAR(sub_firstline); /* free the copy of the original line */
4771  }
4772 
4773  line_breakcheck();
4774  }
4775 
4776  if (first_line != 0)
4777  {
4778  /* Need to subtract the number of added lines from "last_line" to get
4779  * the line number before the change (same as adding the number of
4780  * deleted lines). */
4781  i = curbuf->b_ml.ml_line_count - old_line_count;
4782  changed_lines(first_line, 0, last_line - i, i);
4783  }
4784 
4785 outofmem:
4786  vim_free(sub_firstline); /* may have to free allocated copy of the line */
4787 
4788  /* ":s/pat//n" doesn't move the cursor */
4789  if (subflags.do_count)
4790  curwin->w_cursor = old_cursor;
4791 
4792  if (sub_nsubs > start_nsubs)
4793  {
4794  /* Set the '[ and '] marks. */
4795  curbuf->b_op_start.lnum = eap->line1;
4796  curbuf->b_op_end.lnum = line2;
4797  curbuf->b_op_start.col = curbuf->b_op_end.col = 0;
4798 
4799  if (!global_busy)
4800  {
4801  /* when interactive leave cursor on the match */
4802  if (!subflags.do_ask)
4803  {
4804  if (endcolumn)
4805  coladvance((colnr_T)MAXCOL);
4806  else
4807  beginline(BL_WHITE | BL_FIX);
4808  }
4809  if (!do_sub_msg(subflags.do_count) && subflags.do_ask)
4810  msg("");
4811  }
4812  else
4813  global_need_beginline = TRUE;
4814  if (subflags.do_print)
4815  print_line(curwin->w_cursor.lnum,
4816  subflags.do_number, subflags.do_list);
4817  }
4818  else if (!global_busy)
4819  {
4820  if (got_int) /* interrupted */
4821  emsg(_(e_interr));
4822  else if (got_match) /* did find something but nothing substituted */
4823  msg("");
4824  else if (subflags.do_error) /* nothing found */
4825  semsg(_(e_patnotf2), get_search_pat());
4826  }
4827 
4828 #ifdef FEAT_FOLDING
4829  if (subflags.do_ask && hasAnyFolding(curwin))
4830  /* Cursor position may require updating */
4831  changed_window_setting();
4832 #endif
4833 
4834  vim_regfree(regmatch.regprog);
4835 
4836  /* Restore the flag values, they can be used for ":&&". */
4837  subflags.do_all = save_do_all;
4838  subflags.do_ask = save_do_ask;
4839 }
4840 
4841 /*
4842  * Give message for number of substitutions.
4843  * Can also be used after a ":global" command.
4844  * Return TRUE if a message was given.
4845  */
4846  int
4847 do_sub_msg(
4848  int count_only) /* used 'n' flag for ":s" */
4849 {
4850  /*
4851  * Only report substitutions when:
4852  * - more than 'report' substitutions
4853  * - command was typed by user, or number of changed lines > 'report'
4854  * - giving messages is not disabled by 'lazyredraw'
4855  */
4856  if (((sub_nsubs > p_report && (KeyTyped || sub_nlines > 1 || p_report < 1))
4857  || count_only)
4858  && messaging())
4859  {
4860  char *msg_single;
4861  char *msg_plural;
4862 
4863  if (got_int)
4864  STRCPY(msg_buf, _("(Interrupted) "));
4865  else
4866  *msg_buf = NUL;
4867 
4868  msg_single = count_only
4869  ? NGETTEXT("%ld match on %ld line",
4870  "%ld matches on %ld line", sub_nsubs)
4871  : NGETTEXT("%ld substitution on %ld line",
4872  "%ld substitutions on %ld line", sub_nsubs);
4873  msg_plural = count_only
4874  ? NGETTEXT("%ld match on %ld lines",
4875  "%ld matches on %ld lines", sub_nsubs)
4876  : NGETTEXT("%ld substitution on %ld lines",
4877  "%ld substitutions on %ld lines", sub_nsubs);
4878 
4879  vim_snprintf_add(msg_buf, sizeof(msg_buf),
4880  NGETTEXT(msg_single, msg_plural, sub_nlines),
4881  sub_nsubs, (long)sub_nlines);
4882 
4883  if (msg(msg_buf))
4884  /* save message to display it after redraw */
4885  set_keep_msg((char_u *)msg_buf, 0);
4886  return TRUE;
4887  }
4888  if (got_int)
4889  {
4890  emsg(_(e_interr));
4891  return TRUE;
4892  }
4893  return FALSE;
4894 }
4895 
4896  static void
4897 global_exe_one(char_u *cmd, linenr_T lnum)
4898 {
4899  curwin->w_cursor.lnum = lnum;
4900  curwin->w_cursor.col = 0;
4901  if (*cmd == NUL || *cmd == '\n')
4902  do_cmdline((char_u *)"p", NULL, NULL, DOCMD_NOWAIT);
4903  else
4904  do_cmdline(cmd, NULL, NULL, DOCMD_NOWAIT);
4905 }
4906 
4907 /*
4908  * Execute a global command of the form:
4909  *
4910  * g/pattern/X : execute X on all lines where pattern matches
4911  * v/pattern/X : execute X on all lines where pattern does not match
4912  *
4913  * where 'X' is an EX command
4914  *
4915  * The command character (as well as the trailing slash) is optional, and
4916  * is assumed to be 'p' if missing.
4917  *
4918  * This is implemented in two passes: first we scan the file for the pattern and
4919  * set a mark for each line that (not) matches. Secondly we execute the command
4920  * for each line that has a mark. This is required because after deleting
4921  * lines we do not know where to search for the next match.
4922  */
4923  void
4924 ex_global(exarg_T *eap)
4925 {
4926  linenr_T lnum; /* line number according to old situation */
4927  int ndone = 0;
4928  int type; /* first char of cmd: 'v' or 'g' */
4929  char_u *cmd; /* command argument */
4930 
4931  char_u delim; /* delimiter, normally '/' */
4932  char_u *pat;
4933  regmmatch_T regmatch;
4934  int match;
4935  int which_pat;
4936 
4937  /* When nesting the command works on one line. This allows for
4938  * ":g/found/v/notfound/command". */
4939  if (global_busy && (eap->line1 != 1
4940  || eap->line2 != curbuf->b_ml.ml_line_count))
4941  {
4942  /* will increment global_busy to break out of the loop */
4943  emsg(_("E147: Cannot do :global recursive with a range"));
4944  return;
4945  }
4946 
4947  if (eap->forceit) /* ":global!" is like ":vglobal" */
4948  type = 'v';
4949  else
4950  type = *eap->cmd;
4951  cmd = eap->arg;
4952  which_pat = RE_LAST; /* default: use last used regexp */
4953 
4954  /*
4955  * undocumented vi feature:
4956  * "\/" and "\?": use previous search pattern.
4957  * "\&": use previous substitute pattern.
4958  */
4959  if (*cmd == '\\')
4960  {
4961  ++cmd;
4962  if (vim_strchr((char_u *)"/?&", *cmd) == NULL)
4963  {
4964  emsg(_(e_backslash));
4965  return;
4966  }
4967  if (*cmd == '&')
4968  which_pat = RE_SUBST; /* use previous substitute pattern */
4969  else
4970  which_pat = RE_SEARCH; /* use previous search pattern */
4971  ++cmd;
4972  pat = (char_u *)"";
4973  }
4974  else if (*cmd == NUL)
4975  {
4976  emsg(_("E148: Regular expression missing from global"));
4977  return;
4978  }
4979  else
4980  {
4981  delim = *cmd; /* get the delimiter */
4982  if (delim)
4983  ++cmd; /* skip delimiter if there is one */
4984  pat = cmd; /* remember start of pattern */
4985  cmd = skip_regexp(cmd, delim, p_magic, &eap->arg);
4986  if (cmd[0] == delim) /* end delimiter found */
4987  *cmd++ = NUL; /* replace it with a NUL */
4988  }
4989 
4990  if (search_regcomp(pat, RE_BOTH, which_pat, SEARCH_HIS, &regmatch) == FAIL)
4991  {
4992  emsg(_(e_invcmd));
4993  return;
4994  }
4995 
4996  if (global_busy)
4997  {
4998  lnum = curwin->w_cursor.lnum;
4999  match = vim_regexec_multi(&regmatch, curwin, curbuf, lnum,
5000  (colnr_T)0, NULL, NULL);
5001  if ((type == 'g' && match) || (type == 'v' && !match))
5002  global_exe_one(cmd, lnum);
5003  }
5004  else
5005  {
5006  /*
5007  * pass 1: set marks for each (not) matching line
5008  */
5009  for (lnum = eap->line1; lnum <= eap->line2 && !got_int; ++lnum)
5010  {
5011  /* a match on this line? */
5012  match = vim_regexec_multi(&regmatch, curwin, curbuf, lnum,
5013  (colnr_T)0, NULL, NULL);
5014  if ((type == 'g' && match) || (type == 'v' && !match))
5015  {
5016  ml_setmarked(lnum);
5017  ndone++;
5018  }
5019  line_breakcheck();
5020  }
5021 
5022  /*
5023  * pass 2: execute the command for each line that has been marked
5024  */
5025  if (got_int)
5026  msg(_(e_interr));
5027  else if (ndone == 0)
5028  {
5029  if (type == 'v')
5030  smsg(_("Pattern found in every line: %s"), pat);
5031  else
5032  smsg(_("Pattern not found: %s"), pat);
5033  }
5034  else
5035  {
5036 #ifdef FEAT_CLIPBOARD
5037  start_global_changes();
5038 #endif
5039  global_exe(cmd);
5040 #ifdef FEAT_CLIPBOARD
5041  end_global_changes();
5042 #endif
5043  }
5044 
5045  ml_clearmarked(); /* clear rest of the marks */
5046  }
5047 
5048  vim_regfree(regmatch.regprog);
5049 }
5050 
5051 /*
5052  * Execute "cmd" on lines marked with ml_setmarked().
5053  */
5054  void
5055 global_exe(char_u *cmd)
5056 {
5057  linenr_T old_lcount; /* b_ml.ml_line_count before the command */
5058  buf_T *old_buf = curbuf; /* remember what buffer we started in */
5059  linenr_T lnum; /* line number according to old situation */
5060 
5061  /*
5062  * Set current position only once for a global command.
5063  * If global_busy is set, setpcmark() will not do anything.
5064  * If there is an error, global_busy will be incremented.
5065  */
5066  setpcmark();
5067 
5068  /* When the command writes a message, don't overwrite the command. */
5069  msg_didout = TRUE;
5070 
5071  sub_nsubs = 0;
5072  sub_nlines = 0;
5073  global_need_beginline = FALSE;
5074  global_busy = 1;
5075  old_lcount = curbuf->b_ml.ml_line_count;
5076  while (!got_int && (lnum = ml_firstmarked()) != 0 && global_busy == 1)
5077  {
5078  global_exe_one(cmd, lnum);
5079  ui_breakcheck();
5080  }
5081 
5082  global_busy = 0;
5083  if (global_need_beginline)
5084  beginline(BL_WHITE | BL_FIX);
5085  else
5086  check_cursor(); /* cursor may be beyond the end of the line */
5087 
5088  /* the cursor may not have moved in the text but a change in a previous
5089  * line may move it on the screen */
5090  changed_line_abv_curs();
5091 
5092  /* If it looks like no message was written, allow overwriting the
5093  * command with the report for number of changes. */
5094  if (msg_col == 0 && msg_scrolled == 0)
5095  msg_didout = FALSE;
5096 
5097  /* If substitutes done, report number of substitutes, otherwise report
5098  * number of extra or deleted lines.
5099  * Don't report extra or deleted lines in the edge case where the buffer
5100  * we are in after execution is different from the buffer we started in. */
5101  if (!do_sub_msg(FALSE) && curbuf == old_buf)
5102  msgmore(curbuf->b_ml.ml_line_count - old_lcount);
5103 }

5134 #if defined(FEAT_QUICKFIX) || defined(PROTO)

5136  * Set up for a tagpreview.

5138  */
5139  int
5140 prepare_tagpreview(

5146

5207 
5208 /*
5209  * ":help": open a read-only window on a help file
5210  */
5211  void
5212 ex_help(exarg_T *eap)
5213 {
5214  char_u *arg;
5215  char_u *tag;
5216  FILE *helpfd; /* file descriptor of help file */
5217  int n;
5218  int i;
5219  win_T *wp;
5220  int num_matches;
5221  char_u **matches;
5222  char_u *p;
5223  int empty_fnum = 0;
5224  int alt_fnum = 0;
5225  buf_T *buf;
5226 #ifdef FEAT_MULTI_LANG
5227  int len;
5228  char_u *lang;
5229 #endif
5230 #ifdef FEAT_FOLDING
5231  int old_KeyTyped = KeyTyped;
5232 #endif
5233 
5234  if (eap != NULL)
5235  {
5236  /*
5237  * A ":help" command ends at the first LF, or at a '|' that is
5238  * followed by some text. Set nextcmd to the following command.
5239  */
5240  for (arg = eap->arg; *arg; ++arg)
5241  {
5242  if (*arg == '\n' || *arg == '\r'
5243  || (*arg == '|' && arg[1] != NUL && arg[1] != '|'))
5244  {
5245  *arg++ = NUL;
5246  eap->nextcmd = arg;
5247  break;
5248  }
5249  }
5250  arg = eap->arg;
5251 
5252  if (eap->forceit && *arg == NUL && !curbuf->b_help)
5253  {
5254  emsg(_("E478: Don't panic!"));
5255  return;
5256  }
5257 
5258  if (eap->skip) /* not executing commands */
5259  return;
5260  }
5261  else
5262  arg = (char_u *)"";
5263 
5264  /* remove trailing blanks */
5265  p = arg + STRLEN(arg) - 1;
5266  while (p > arg && VIM_ISWHITE(*p) && p[-1] != '\\')
5267  *p-- = NUL;
5268 
5269 #ifdef FEAT_MULTI_LANG
5270  /* Check for a specified language */
5271  lang = check_help_lang(arg);
5272 #endif
5273 
5274  /* When no argument given go to the index. */
5275  if (*arg == NUL)
5276  arg = (char_u *)"help.txt";
5277 
5278  /*
5279  * Check if there is a match for the argument.
5280  */
5281  n = find_help_tags(arg, &num_matches, &matches,
5282  eap != NULL && eap->forceit);
5283 
5284  i = 0;
5285 #ifdef FEAT_MULTI_LANG
5286  if (n != FAIL && lang != NULL)
5287  /* Find first item with the requested language. */
5288  for (i = 0; i < num_matches; ++i)
5289  {
5290  len = (int)STRLEN(matches[i]);
5291  if (len > 3 && matches[i][len - 3] == '@'
5292  && STRICMP(matches[i] + len - 2, lang) == 0)
5293  break;
5294  }
5295 #endif
5296  if (i >= num_matches || n == FAIL)
5297  {
5298 #ifdef FEAT_MULTI_LANG
5299  if (lang != NULL)
5300  semsg(_("E661: Sorry, no '%s' help for %s"), lang, arg);
5301  else
5302 #endif
5303  semsg(_("E149: Sorry, no help for %s"), arg);
5304  if (n != FAIL)
5305  FreeWild(num_matches, matches);
5306  return;
5307  }
5308 
5309  /* The first match (in the requested language) is the best match. */
5310  tag = vim_strsave(matches[i]);
5311  FreeWild(num_matches, matches);
5312 
5313 #ifdef FEAT_GUI
5314  need_mouse_correct = TRUE;
5315 #endif
5316 
5317  /*
5318  * Re-use an existing help window or open a new one.
5319  * Always open a new one for ":tab help".
5320  */
5321  if (!bt_help(curwin->w_buffer) || cmdmod.tab != 0)
5322  {
5323  if (cmdmod.tab != 0)
5324  wp = NULL;
5325  else
5326  FOR_ALL_WINDOWS(wp)
5327  if (bt_help(wp->w_buffer))
5328  break;
5329  if (wp != NULL && wp->w_buffer->b_nwindows > 0)
5330  win_enter(wp, TRUE);
5331  else
5332  {
5333  /*
5334  * There is no help window yet.
5335  * Try to open the file specified by the "helpfile" option.
5336  */
5337  if ((helpfd = mch_fopen((char *)p_hf, READBIN)) == NULL)
5338  {
5339  smsg(_("Sorry, help file \"%s\" not found"), p_hf);
5340  goto erret;
5341  }
5342  fclose(helpfd);
5343 
5344  /* Split off help window; put it at far top if no position
5345  * specified, the current window is vertically split and
5346  * narrow. */
5347  n = WSP_HELP;
5348  if (cmdmod.split == 0 && curwin->w_width != Columns
5349  && curwin->w_width < 80)
5350  n |= WSP_TOP;
5351  if (win_split(0, n) == FAIL)
5352  goto erret;
5353 
5354  if (curwin->w_height < p_hh)
5355  win_setheight((int)p_hh);
5356 
5357  /*
5358  * Open help file (do_ecmd() will set b_help flag, readfile() will
5359  * set b_p_ro flag).
5360  * Set the alternate file to the previously edited file.
5361  */
5362  alt_fnum = curbuf->b_fnum;
5363  (void)do_ecmd(0, NULL, NULL, NULL, ECMD_LASTL,
5364  ECMD_HIDE + ECMD_SET_HELP,
5365  NULL); /* buffer is still open, don't store info */
5366  if (!cmdmod.keepalt)
5367  curwin->w_alt_fnum = alt_fnum;
5368  empty_fnum = curbuf->b_fnum;
5369  }
5370  }
5371 
5372  if (!p_im)
5373  restart_edit = 0; /* don't want insert mode in help file */
5374 
5375 #ifdef FEAT_FOLDING
5376  /* Restore KeyTyped, setting 'filetype=help' may reset it.
5377  * It is needed for do_tag top open folds under the cursor. */
5378  KeyTyped = old_KeyTyped;
5379 #endif
5380 
5381  if (tag != NULL)
5382  do_tag(tag, DT_HELP, 1, FALSE, TRUE);
5383 
5384  /* Delete the empty buffer if we're not using it. Careful: autocommands
5385  * may have jumped to another window, check that the buffer is not in a
5386  * window. */
5387  if (empty_fnum != 0 && curbuf->b_fnum != empty_fnum)
5388  {
5389  buf = buflist_findnr(empty_fnum);
5390  if (buf != NULL && buf->b_nwindows == 0)
5391  wipe_buffer(buf, TRUE);
5392  }
5393 
5394  /* keep the previous alternate file */
5395  if (alt_fnum != 0 && curwin->w_alt_fnum == empty_fnum && !cmdmod.keepalt)
5396  curwin->w_alt_fnum = alt_fnum;
5397 
5398 erret:
5399  vim_free(tag);
5400 }
5401 
5402 /*
5403  * ":helpclose": Close one help window
5404  */
5405  void
5406 ex_helpclose(exarg_T *eap UNUSED)
5407 {
5408  win_T *win;
5409 
5410  FOR_ALL_WINDOWS(win)
5411  {
5412  if (bt_help(win->w_buffer))
5413  {
5414  win_close(win, FALSE);
5415  return;
5416  }
5417  }
5418 }
5419 
5420 #if defined(FEAT_MULTI_LANG) || defined(PROTO)
5421 /*
5422  * In an argument search for a language specifiers in the form "@xx".
5423  * Changes the "@" to NUL if found, and returns a pointer to "xx".
5424  * Returns NULL if not found.
5425  */
5426  char_u *
5427 check_help_lang(char_u *arg)
5428 {
5429  int len = (int)STRLEN(arg);
5430 
5431  if (len >= 3 && arg[len - 3] == '@' && ASCII_ISALPHA(arg[len - 2])
5432  && ASCII_ISALPHA(arg[len - 1]))
5433  {
5434  arg[len - 3] = NUL; /* remove the '@' */
5435  return arg + len - 2;
5436  }
5437  return NULL;
5438 }
5439 #endif
5440 
5441 /*
5442  * Return a heuristic indicating how well the given string matches. The
5443  * smaller the number, the better the match. This is the order of priorities,
5444  * from best match to worst match:
5445  * - Match with least alpha-numeric characters is better.
5446  * - Match with least total characters is better.
5447  * - Match towards the start is better.
5448  * - Match starting with "+" is worse (feature instead of command)
5449  * Assumption is made that the matched_string passed has already been found to
5450  * match some string for which help is requested. webb.
5451  */
5452  int
5453 help_heuristic(
5454  char_u *matched_string,
5455  int offset, /* offset for match */
5456  int wrong_case) /* no matching case */
5457 {
5458  int num_letters;
5459  char_u *p;
5460 
5461  num_letters = 0;
5462  for (p = matched_string; *p; p++)
5463  if (ASCII_ISALNUM(*p))
5464  num_letters++;
5465 
5466  /*
5467  * Multiply the number of letters by 100 to give it a much bigger
5468  * weighting than the number of characters.
5469  * If there only is a match while ignoring case, add 5000.
5470  * If the match starts in the middle of a word, add 10000 to put it
5471  * somewhere in the last half.
5472  * If the match is more than 2 chars from the start, multiply by 200 to
5473  * put it after matches at the start.
5474  */
5475  if (ASCII_ISALNUM(matched_string[offset]) && offset > 0
5476  && ASCII_ISALNUM(matched_string[offset - 1]))
5477  offset += 10000;
5478  else if (offset > 2)
5479  offset *= 200;
5480  if (wrong_case)
5481  offset += 5000;
5482  /* Features are less interesting than the subjects themselves, but "+"
5483  * alone is not a feature. */
5484  if (matched_string[0] == '+' && matched_string[1] != NUL)
5485  offset += 100;
5486  return (int)(100 * num_letters + STRLEN(matched_string) + offset);
5487 }
5488 
5489 /*
5490  * Compare functions for qsort() below, that checks the help heuristics number
5491  * that has been put after the tagname by find_tags().
5492  */
5493  static int
5494 help_compare(const void *s1, const void *s2)
5495 {
5496  char *p1;
5497  char *p2;
5498 
5499  p1 = *(char **)s1 + strlen(*(char **)s1) + 1;
5500  p2 = *(char **)s2 + strlen(*(char **)s2) + 1;
5501  return strcmp(p1, p2);
5502 }
5503 
5504 /*
5505  * Find all help tags matching "arg", sort them and return in matches[], with
5506  * the number of matches in num_matches.
5507  * The matches will be sorted with a "best" match algorithm.
5508  * When "keep_lang" is TRUE try keeping the language of the current buffer.
5509  */
5510  int
5511 find_help_tags(
5512  char_u *arg,
5513  int *num_matches,
5514  char_u ***matches,
5515  int keep_lang)
5516 {
5517  char_u *s, *d;
5518  int i;
5519  static char *(mtable[]) = {"*", "g*", "[*", "]*", ":*",
5520  "/*", "/\\*", "\"*", "**",
5521  "cpo-*", "/\\(\\)", "/\\%(\\)",
5522  "?", ":?", "?<CR>", "g?", "g?g?", "g??",
5523  "-?", "q?", "v_g?",
5524  "/\\?", "/\\z(\\)", "\\=", ":s\\=",
5525  "[count]", "[quotex]",
5526  "[range]", ":[range]",
5527  "[pattern]", "\\|", "\\%$",
5528  "s/\\~", "s/\\U", "s/\\L",
5529  "s/\\1", "s/\\2", "s/\\3", "s/\\9"};
5530  static char *(rtable[]) = {"star", "gstar", "[star", "]star", ":star",
5531  "/star", "/\\\\star", "quotestar", "starstar",
5532  "cpo-star", "/\\\\(\\\\)", "/\\\\%(\\\\)",
5533  "?", ":?", "?<CR>", "g?", "g?g?", "g??",
5534  "-?", "q?", "v_g?",
5535  "/\\\\?", "/\\\\z(\\\\)", "\\\\=", ":s\\\\=",
5536  "\\[count]", "\\[quotex]",
5537  "\\[range]", ":\\[range]",
5538  "\\[pattern]", "\\\\bar", "/\\\\%\\$",
5539  "s/\\\\\\~", "s/\\\\U", "s/\\\\L",
5540  "s/\\\\1", "s/\\\\2", "s/\\\\3", "s/\\\\9"};
5541  static char *(expr_table[]) = {"!=?", "!~?", "<=?", "<?", "==?", "=~?",
5542  ">=?", ">?", "is?", "isnot?"};
5543  int flags;
5544 
5545  d = IObuff; /* assume IObuff is long enough! */
5546 
5547  if (STRNICMP(arg, "expr-", 5) == 0)
5548  {
5549  // When the string starting with "expr-" and containing '?' and matches
5550  // the table, it is taken literally. Otherwise '?' is recognized as a
5551  // wildcard.
5552  for (i = (int)(sizeof(expr_table) / sizeof(char *)); --i >= 0; )
5553  if (STRCMP(arg + 5, expr_table[i]) == 0)
5554  {
5555  STRCPY(d, arg);
5556  break;
5557  }
5558  }
5559  else
5560  {
5561  // Recognize a few exceptions to the rule. Some strings that contain
5562  // '*' with "star". Otherwise '*' is recognized as a wildcard.
5563  for (i = (int)(sizeof(mtable) / sizeof(char *)); --i >= 0; )
5564  if (STRCMP(arg, mtable[i]) == 0)
5565  {
5566  STRCPY(d, rtable[i]);
5567  break;
5568  }
5569  }
5570 
5571  if (i < 0) /* no match in table */
5572  {
5573  /* Replace "\S" with "/\\S", etc. Otherwise every tag is matched.
5574  * Also replace "\%^" and "\%(", they match every tag too.
5575  * Also "\zs", "\z1", etc.
5576  * Also "\@<", "\@=", "\@<=", etc.
5577  * And also "\_$" and "\_^". */
5578  if (arg[0] == '\\'
5579  && ((arg[1] != NUL && arg[2] == NUL)
5580  || (vim_strchr((char_u *)"%_z@", arg[1]) != NULL
5581  && arg[2] != NUL)))
5582  {
5583  STRCPY(d, "/\\\\");
5584  STRCPY(d + 3, arg + 1);
5585  /* Check for "/\\_$", should be "/\\_\$" */
5586  if (d[3] == '_' && d[4] == '$')
5587  STRCPY(d + 4, "\\$");
5588  }
5589  else
5590  {
5591  /* Replace:
5592  * "[:...:]" with "\[:...:]"
5593  * "[++...]" with "\[++...]"
5594  * "\{" with "\\{" -- matching "} \}"
5595  */
5596  if ((arg[0] == '[' && (arg[1] == ':'
5597  || (arg[1] == '+' && arg[2] == '+')))
5598  || (arg[0] == '\\' && arg[1] == '{'))
5599  *d++ = '\\';
5600 
5601  /*
5602  * If tag starts with "('", skip the "(". Fixes CTRL-] on ('option'.
5603  */
5604  if (*arg == '(' && arg[1] == '\'')
5605  arg++;
5606  for (s = arg; *s; ++s)
5607  {
5608  /*
5609  * Replace "|" with "bar" and '"' with "quote" to match the name of
5610  * the tags for these commands.
5611  * Replace "*" with ".*" and "?" with "." to match command line
5612  * completion.
5613  * Insert a backslash before '~', '$' and '.' to avoid their
5614  * special meaning.
5615  */
5616  if (d - IObuff > IOSIZE - 10) /* getting too long!? */
5617  break;
5618  switch (*s)
5619  {
5620  case '|': STRCPY(d, "bar");
5621  d += 3;
5622  continue;
5623  case '"': STRCPY(d, "quote");
5624  d += 5;
5625  continue;
5626  case '*': *d++ = '.';
5627  break;
5628  case '?': *d++ = '.';
5629  continue;
5630  case '$':
5631  case '.':
5632  case '~': *d++ = '\\';
5633  break;
5634  }
5635 
5636  /*
5637  * Replace "^x" by "CTRL-X". Don't do this for "^_" to make
5638  * ":help i_^_CTRL-D" work.
5639  * Insert '-' before and after "CTRL-X" when applicable.
5640  */
5641  if (*s < ' ' || (*s == '^' && s[1] && (ASCII_ISALPHA(s[1])
5642  || vim_strchr((char_u *)"?@[\\]^", s[1]) != NULL)))
5643  {
5644  if (d > IObuff && d[-1] != '_' && d[-1] != '\\')
5645  *d++ = '_'; /* prepend a '_' to make x_CTRL-x */
5646  STRCPY(d, "CTRL-");
5647  d += 5;
5648  if (*s < ' ')
5649  {
5650 #ifdef EBCDIC
5651  *d++ = CtrlChar(*s);
5652 #else
5653  *d++ = *s + '@';
5654 #endif
5655  if (d[-1] == '\\')
5656  *d++ = '\\'; /* double a backslash */
5657  }
5658  else
5659  *d++ = *++s;
5660  if (s[1] != NUL && s[1] != '_')
5661  *d++ = '_'; /* append a '_' */
5662  continue;
5663  }
5664  else if (*s == '^') /* "^" or "CTRL-^" or "^_" */
5665  *d++ = '\\';
5666 
5667  /*
5668  * Insert a backslash before a backslash after a slash, for search
5669  * pattern tags: "/\|" --> "/\\|".
5670  */
5671  else if (s[0] == '\\' && s[1] != '\\'
5672  && *arg == '/' && s == arg + 1)
5673  *d++ = '\\';
5674 
5675  /* "CTRL-\_" -> "CTRL-\\_" to avoid the special meaning of "\_" in
5676  * "CTRL-\_CTRL-N" */
5677  if (STRNICMP(s, "CTRL-\\_", 7) == 0)
5678  {
5679  STRCPY(d, "CTRL-\\\\");
5680  d += 7;
5681  s += 6;
5682  }
5683 
5684  *d++ = *s;
5685 
5686  /*
5687  * If tag contains "({" or "([", tag terminates at the "(".
5688  * This is for help on functions, e.g.: abs({expr}).
5689  */
5690  if (*s == '(' && (s[1] == '{' || s[1] =='['))
5691  break;
5692 
5693  /*
5694  * If tag starts with ', toss everything after a second '. Fixes
5695  * CTRL-] on 'option'. (would include the trailing '.').
5696  */
5697  if (*s == '\'' && s > arg && *arg == '\'')
5698  break;
5699  /* Also '{' and '}'. */
5700  if (*s == '}' && s > arg && *arg == '{')
5701  break;
5702  }
5703  *d = NUL;
5704 
5705  if (*IObuff == '`')
5706  {
5707  if (d > IObuff + 2 && d[-1] == '`')
5708  {
5709  /* remove the backticks from `command` */
5710  mch_memmove(IObuff, IObuff + 1, STRLEN(IObuff));
5711  d[-2] = NUL;
5712  }
5713  else if (d > IObuff + 3 && d[-2] == '`' && d[-1] == ',')
5714  {
5715  /* remove the backticks and comma from `command`, */
5716  mch_memmove(IObuff, IObuff + 1, STRLEN(IObuff));
5717  d[-3] = NUL;
5718  }
5719  else if (d > IObuff + 4 && d[-3] == '`'
5720  && d[-2] == '\\' && d[-1] == '.')
5721  {
5722  /* remove the backticks and dot from `command`\. */
5723  mch_memmove(IObuff, IObuff + 1, STRLEN(IObuff));
5724  d[-4] = NUL;
5725  }
5726  }
5727  }
5728  }
5729 
5730  *matches = (char_u **)"";
5731  *num_matches = 0;
5732  flags = TAG_HELP | TAG_REGEXP | TAG_NAMES | TAG_VERBOSE | TAG_NO_TAGFUNC;
5733  if (keep_lang)
5734  flags |= TAG_KEEP_LANG;
5735  if (find_tags(IObuff, num_matches, matches, flags, (int)MAXCOL, NULL) == OK
5736  && *num_matches > 0)
5737  {
5738  /* Sort the matches found on the heuristic number that is after the
5739  * tag name. */
5740  qsort((void *)*matches, (size_t)*num_matches,
5741  sizeof(char_u *), help_compare);
5742  /* Delete more than TAG_MANY to reduce the size of the listing. */
5743  while (*num_matches > TAG_MANY)
5744  vim_free((*matches)[--*num_matches]);
5745  }
5746  return OK;
5747 }
5748 
5749 /*
5750  * Called when starting to edit a buffer for a help file.
5751  */
5752  static void
5753 prepare_help_buffer(void)
5754 {
5755  char_u *p;
5756 
5757  curbuf->b_help = TRUE;
5758 #ifdef FEAT_QUICKFIX
5759  set_string_option_direct((char_u *)"buftype", -1,
5760  (char_u *)"help", OPT_FREE|OPT_LOCAL, 0);
5761 #endif
5762 
5763  /*
5764  * Always set these options after jumping to a help tag, because the
5765  * user may have an autocommand that gets in the way.
5766  * Accept all ASCII chars for keywords, except ' ', '*', '"', '|', and
5767  * latin1 word characters (for translated help files).
5768  * Only set it when needed, buf_init_chartab() is some work.
5769  */
5770  p =
5771 #ifdef EBCDIC
5772  (char_u *)"65-255,^*,^|,^\"";
5773 #else
5774  (char_u *)"!-~,^*,^|,^\",192-255";
5775 #endif
5776  if (STRCMP(curbuf->b_p_isk, p) != 0)
5777  {
5778  set_string_option_direct((char_u *)"isk", -1, p, OPT_FREE|OPT_LOCAL, 0);
5779  check_buf_options(curbuf);
5780  (void)buf_init_chartab(curbuf, FALSE);
5781  }
5782 
5783 #ifdef FEAT_FOLDING
5784  /* Don't use the global foldmethod.*/
5785  set_string_option_direct((char_u *)"fdm", -1, (char_u *)"manual",
5786  OPT_FREE|OPT_LOCAL, 0);
5787 #endif
5788 
5789  curbuf->b_p_ts = 8; /* 'tabstop' is 8 */
5790  curwin->w_p_list = FALSE; /* no list mode */
5791 
5792  curbuf->b_p_ma = FALSE; /* not modifiable */
5793  curbuf->b_p_bin = FALSE; /* reset 'bin' before reading file */
5794  curwin->w_p_nu = 0; /* no line numbers */
5795  curwin->w_p_rnu = 0; /* no relative line numbers */
5796  RESET_BINDING(curwin); /* no scroll or cursor binding */
5797 #ifdef FEAT_ARABIC
5798  curwin->w_p_arab = FALSE; /* no arabic mode */
5799 #endif
5800 #ifdef FEAT_RIGHTLEFT
5801  curwin->w_p_rl = FALSE; /* help window is left-to-right */
5802 #endif
5803 #ifdef FEAT_FOLDING
5804  curwin->w_p_fen = FALSE; /* No folding in the help window */
5805 #endif
5806 #ifdef FEAT_DIFF
5807  curwin->w_p_diff = FALSE; /* No 'diff' */
5808 #endif
5809 #ifdef FEAT_SPELL
5810  curwin->w_p_spell = FALSE; /* No spell checking */
5811 #endif
5812 
5813  set_buflisted(FALSE);
5814 }
