5816 /*
5817  * After reading a help file: May cleanup a help buffer when syntax
5818  * highlighting is not used.
5819  */
5820  void
5821 fix_help_buffer(void)
5822 {
5823  linenr_T lnum;
5824  char_u *line;
5825  int in_example = FALSE;
5826  int len;
5827  char_u *fname;
5828  char_u *p;
5829  char_u *rt;
5830  int mustfree;
5831 
5832  /* Set filetype to "help" if still needed. */
5833  if (STRCMP(curbuf->b_p_ft, "help") != 0)
5834  {
5835  ++curbuf_lock;
5836  set_option_value((char_u *)"ft", 0L, (char_u *)"help", OPT_LOCAL);
5837  --curbuf_lock;
5838  }
5839 
5840 #ifdef FEAT_SYN_HL
5841  if (!syntax_present(curwin))
5842 #endif
5843  {
5844  for (lnum = 1; lnum <= curbuf->b_ml.ml_line_count; ++lnum)
5845  {
5846  line = ml_get_buf(curbuf, lnum, FALSE);
5847  len = (int)STRLEN(line);
5848  if (in_example && len > 0 && !VIM_ISWHITE(line[0]))
5849  {
5850  /* End of example: non-white or '<' in first column. */
5851  if (line[0] == '<')
5852  {
5853  /* blank-out a '<' in the first column */
5854  line = ml_get_buf(curbuf, lnum, TRUE);
5855  line[0] = ' ';
5856  }
5857  in_example = FALSE;
5858  }
5859  if (!in_example && len > 0)
5860  {
5861  if (line[len - 1] == '>' && (len == 1 || line[len - 2] == ' '))
5862  {
5863  /* blank-out a '>' in the last column (start of example) */
5864  line = ml_get_buf(curbuf, lnum, TRUE);
5865  line[len - 1] = ' ';
5866  in_example = TRUE;
5867  }
5868  else if (line[len - 1] == '~')
5869  {
5870  /* blank-out a '~' at the end of line (header marker) */
5871  line = ml_get_buf(curbuf, lnum, TRUE);
5872  line[len - 1] = ' ';
5873  }
5874  }
5875  }
5876  }
5877 
5878  /*
5879  * In the "help.txt" and "help.abx" file, add the locally added help
5880  * files. This uses the very first line in the help file.
5881  */
5882  fname = gettail(curbuf->b_fname);
5883  if (fnamecmp(fname, "help.txt") == 0
5884 #ifdef FEAT_MULTI_LANG
5885  || (fnamencmp(fname, "help.", 5) == 0
5886  && ASCII_ISALPHA(fname[5])
5887  && ASCII_ISALPHA(fname[6])
5888  && TOLOWER_ASC(fname[7]) == 'x'
5889  && fname[8] == NUL)
5890 #endif
5891  )
5892  {
5893  for (lnum = 1; lnum < curbuf->b_ml.ml_line_count; ++lnum)
5894  {
5895  line = ml_get_buf(curbuf, lnum, FALSE);
5896  if (strstr((char *)line, "*local-additions*") == NULL)
5897  continue;
5898 
5899  /* Go through all directories in 'runtimepath', skipping
5900  * $VIMRUNTIME. */
5901  p = p_rtp;
5902  while (*p != NUL)
5903  {
5904  copy_option_part(&p, NameBuff, MAXPATHL, ",");
5905  mustfree = FALSE;
5906  rt = vim_getenv((char_u *)"VIMRUNTIME", &mustfree);
5907  if (rt != NULL &&
5908  fullpathcmp(rt, NameBuff, FALSE, TRUE) != FPC_SAME)
5909  {
5910  int fcount;
5911  char_u **fnames;
5912  FILE *fd;
5913  char_u *s;
5914  int fi;
5915  vimconv_T vc;
5916  char_u *cp;
5917 
5918  /* Find all "doc/ *.txt" files in this directory. */
5919  add_pathsep(NameBuff);
5920 #ifdef FEAT_MULTI_LANG
5921  STRCAT(NameBuff, "doc/*.??[tx]");
5922 #else
5923  STRCAT(NameBuff, "doc/*.txt");
5924 #endif
5925  if (gen_expand_wildcards(1, &NameBuff, &fcount,
5926  &fnames, EW_FILE|EW_SILENT) == OK
5927  && fcount > 0)
5928  {
5929 #ifdef FEAT_MULTI_LANG
5930  int i1, i2;
5931  char_u *f1, *f2;
5932  char_u *t1, *t2;
5933  char_u *e1, *e2;
5934 
5935  /* If foo.abx is found use it instead of foo.txt in
5936  * the same directory. */
5937  for (i1 = 0; i1 < fcount; ++i1)
5938  {
5939  for (i2 = 0; i2 < fcount; ++i2)
5940  {
5941  if (i1 == i2)
5942  continue;
5943  if (fnames[i1] == NULL || fnames[i2] == NULL)
5944  continue;
5945  f1 = fnames[i1];
5946  f2 = fnames[i2];
5947  t1 = gettail(f1);
5948  t2 = gettail(f2);
5949  e1 = vim_strrchr(t1, '.');
5950  e2 = vim_strrchr(t2, '.');
5951  if (e1 == NULL || e2 == NULL)
5952  continue;
5953  if (fnamecmp(e1, ".txt") != 0
5954  && fnamecmp(e1, fname + 4) != 0)
5955  {
5956  /* Not .txt and not .abx, remove it. */
5957  VIM_CLEAR(fnames[i1]);
5958  continue;
5959  }
5960  if (e1 - f1 != e2 - f2
5961  || fnamencmp(f1, f2, e1 - f1) != 0)
5962  continue;
5963  if (fnamecmp(e1, ".txt") == 0
5964  && fnamecmp(e2, fname + 4) == 0)
5965  /* use .abx instead of .txt */
5966  VIM_CLEAR(fnames[i1]);
5967  }
5968  }
5969 #endif
5970  for (fi = 0; fi < fcount; ++fi)
5971  {
5972  if (fnames[fi] == NULL)
5973  continue;
5974  fd = mch_fopen((char *)fnames[fi], "r");
5975  if (fd != NULL)
5976  {
5977  vim_fgets(IObuff, IOSIZE, fd);
5978  if (IObuff[0] == '*'
5979  && (s = vim_strchr(IObuff + 1, '*'))
5980  != NULL)
5981  {
5982  int this_utf = MAYBE;
5983 
5984  /* Change tag definition to a
5985  * reference and remove <CR>/<NL>. */
5986  IObuff[0] = '|';
5987  *s = '|';
5988  while (*s != NUL)
5989  {
5990  if (*s == '\r' || *s == '\n')
5991  *s = NUL;
5992  /* The text is utf-8 when a byte
5993  * above 127 is found and no
5994  * illegal byte sequence is found.
5995  */
5996  if (*s >= 0x80 && this_utf != FALSE)
5997  {
5998  int l;
5999 
6000  this_utf = TRUE;
6001  l = utf_ptr2len(s);
6002  if (l == 1)
6003  this_utf = FALSE;
6004  s += l - 1;
6005  }
6006  ++s;
6007  }
6008 
6009  /* The help file is latin1 or utf-8;
6010  * conversion to the current
6011  * 'encoding' may be required. */
6012  vc.vc_type = CONV_NONE;
6013  convert_setup(&vc, (char_u *)(
6014  this_utf == TRUE ? "utf-8"
6015  : "latin1"), p_enc);
6016  if (vc.vc_type == CONV_NONE)
6017  /* No conversion needed. */
6018  cp = IObuff;
6019  else
6020  {
6021  /* Do the conversion. If it fails
6022  * use the unconverted text. */
6023  cp = string_convert(&vc, IObuff,
6024  NULL);
6025  if (cp == NULL)
6026  cp = IObuff;
6027  }
6028  convert_setup(&vc, NULL, NULL);
6029 
6030  ml_append(lnum, cp, (colnr_T)0, FALSE);
6031  if (cp != IObuff)
6032  vim_free(cp);
6033  ++lnum;
6034  }
6035  fclose(fd);
6036  }
6037  }
6038  FreeWild(fcount, fnames);
6039  }
6040  }
6041  if (mustfree)
6042  vim_free(rt);
6043  }
6044  break;
6045  }
6046  }
6047 }
6048 
6049 /*
6050  * ":exusage"
6051  */
6052  void
6053 ex_exusage(exarg_T *eap UNUSED)
6054 {
6055  do_cmdline_cmd((char_u *)"help ex-cmd-index");
6056 }
6057 
6058 /*
6059  * ":viusage"
6060  */
6061  void
6062 ex_viusage(exarg_T *eap UNUSED)
6063 {
6064  do_cmdline_cmd((char_u *)"help normal-index");
6065 }
6066 
6067 /*
6068  * Generate tags in one help directory.
6069  */
6070  static void
6071 helptags_one(
6072  char_u *dir, /* doc directory */
6073  char_u *ext, /* suffix, ".txt", ".itx", ".frx", etc. */
6074  char_u *tagfname, /* "tags" for English, "tags-fr" for French. */
6075  int add_help_tags) /* add "help-tags" tag */
6076 {
6077  FILE *fd_tags;
6078  FILE *fd;
6079  garray_T ga;
6080  int filecount;
6081  char_u **files;
6082  char_u *p1, *p2;
6083  int fi;
6084  char_u *s;
6085  int i;
6086  char_u *fname;
6087  int dirlen;
6088  int utf8 = MAYBE;
6089  int this_utf8;
6090  int firstline;
6091  int mix = FALSE; /* detected mixed encodings */
6092 
6093  /*
6094  * Find all *.txt files.
6095  */
6096  dirlen = (int)STRLEN(dir);
6097  STRCPY(NameBuff, dir);
6098  STRCAT(NameBuff, "/**/*");
6099  STRCAT(NameBuff, ext);
6100  if (gen_expand_wildcards(1, &NameBuff, &filecount, &files,
6101  EW_FILE|EW_SILENT) == FAIL
6102  || filecount == 0)
6103  {
6104  if (!got_int)
6105  semsg(_("E151: No match: %s"), NameBuff);
6106  return;
6107  }
6108 
6109  /*
6110  * Open the tags file for writing.
6111  * Do this before scanning through all the files.
6112  */
6113  STRCPY(NameBuff, dir);
6114  add_pathsep(NameBuff);
6115  STRCAT(NameBuff, tagfname);
6116  fd_tags = mch_fopen((char *)NameBuff, "w");
6117  if (fd_tags == NULL)
6118  {
6119  semsg(_("E152: Cannot open %s for writing"), NameBuff);
6120  FreeWild(filecount, files);
6121  return;
6122  }
6123 
6124  /*
6125  * If using the "++t" argument or generating tags for "$VIMRUNTIME/doc"
6126  * add the "help-tags" tag.
6127  */
6128  ga_init2(&ga, (int)sizeof(char_u *), 100);
6129  if (add_help_tags || fullpathcmp((char_u *)"$VIMRUNTIME/doc",
6130  dir, FALSE, TRUE) == FPC_SAME)
6131  {
6132  if (ga_grow(&ga, 1) == FAIL)
6133  got_int = TRUE;
6134  else
6135  {
6136  s = alloc(18 + (unsigned)STRLEN(tagfname));
6137  if (s == NULL)
6138  got_int = TRUE;
6139  else
6140  {
6141  sprintf((char *)s, "help-tags\t%s\t1\n", tagfname);
6142  ((char_u **)ga.ga_data)[ga.ga_len] = s;
6143  ++ga.ga_len;
6144  }
6145  }
6146  }
6147 
6148  /*
6149  * Go over all the files and extract the tags.
6150  */
6151  for (fi = 0; fi < filecount && !got_int; ++fi)
6152  {
6153  fd = mch_fopen((char *)files[fi], "r");
6154  if (fd == NULL)
6155  {
6156  semsg(_("E153: Unable to open %s for reading"), files[fi]);
6157  continue;
6158  }
6159  fname = files[fi] + dirlen + 1;
6160 
6161  firstline = TRUE;
6162  while (!vim_fgets(IObuff, IOSIZE, fd) && !got_int)
6163  {
6164  if (firstline)
6165  {
6166  /* Detect utf-8 file by a non-ASCII char in the first line. */
6167  this_utf8 = MAYBE;
6168  for (s = IObuff; *s != NUL; ++s)
6169  if (*s >= 0x80)
6170  {
6171  int l;
6172 
6173  this_utf8 = TRUE;
6174  l = utf_ptr2len(s);
6175  if (l == 1)
6176  {
6177  /* Illegal UTF-8 byte sequence. */
6178  this_utf8 = FALSE;
6179  break;
6180  }
6181  s += l - 1;
6182  }
6183  if (this_utf8 == MAYBE) /* only ASCII characters found */
6184  this_utf8 = FALSE;
6185  if (utf8 == MAYBE) /* first file */
6186  utf8 = this_utf8;
6187  else if (utf8 != this_utf8)
6188  {
6189  semsg(_("E670: Mix of help file encodings within a language: %s"), files[fi]);
6190  mix = !got_int;
6191  got_int = TRUE;
6192  }
6193  firstline = FALSE;
6194  }
6195  p1 = vim_strchr(IObuff, '*'); /* find first '*' */
6196  while (p1 != NULL)
6197  {
6198  /* Use vim_strbyte() instead of vim_strchr() so that when
6199  * 'encoding' is dbcs it still works, don't find '*' in the
6200  * second byte. */
6201  p2 = vim_strbyte(p1 + 1, '*'); /* find second '*' */
6202  if (p2 != NULL && p2 > p1 + 1) /* skip "*" and "**" */
6203  {
6204  for (s = p1 + 1; s < p2; ++s)
6205  if (*s == ' ' || *s == '\t' || *s == '|')
6206  break;
6207 
6208  /*
6209  * Only accept a *tag* when it consists of valid
6210  * characters, there is white space before it and is
6211  * followed by a white character or end-of-line.
6212  */
6213  if (s == p2
6214  && (p1 == IObuff || p1[-1] == ' ' || p1[-1] == '\t')
6215  && (vim_strchr((char_u *)" \t\n\r", s[1]) != NULL
6216  || s[1] == '\0'))
6217  {
6218  *p2 = '\0';
6219  ++p1;
6220  if (ga_grow(&ga, 1) == FAIL)
6221  {
6222  got_int = TRUE;
6223  break;
6224  }
6225  s = alloc(p2 - p1 + STRLEN(fname) + 2);
6226  if (s == NULL)
6227  {
6228  got_int = TRUE;
6229  break;
6230  }
6231  ((char_u **)ga.ga_data)[ga.ga_len] = s;
6232  ++ga.ga_len;
6233  sprintf((char *)s, "%s\t%s", p1, fname);
6234 
6235  /* find next '*' */
6236  p2 = vim_strchr(p2 + 1, '*');
6237  }
6238  }
6239  p1 = p2;
6240  }
6241  line_breakcheck();
6242  }
6243 
6244  fclose(fd);
6245  }
6246 
6247  FreeWild(filecount, files);
6248 
6249  if (!got_int)
6250  {
6251  /*
6252  * Sort the tags.
6253  */
6254  if (ga.ga_data != NULL)
6255  sort_strings((char_u **)ga.ga_data, ga.ga_len);
6256 
6257  /*
6258  * Check for duplicates.
6259  */
6260  for (i = 1; i < ga.ga_len; ++i)
6261  {
6262  p1 = ((char_u **)ga.ga_data)[i - 1];
6263  p2 = ((char_u **)ga.ga_data)[i];
6264  while (*p1 == *p2)
6265  {
6266  if (*p2 == '\t')
6267  {
6268  *p2 = NUL;
6269  vim_snprintf((char *)NameBuff, MAXPATHL,
6270  _("E154: Duplicate tag \"%s\" in file %s/%s"),
6271  ((char_u **)ga.ga_data)[i], dir, p2 + 1);
6272  emsg((char *)NameBuff);
6273  *p2 = '\t';
6274  break;
6275  }
6276  ++p1;
6277  ++p2;
6278  }
6279  }
6280 
6281  if (utf8 == TRUE)
6282  fprintf(fd_tags, "!_TAG_FILE_ENCODING\tutf-8\t//\n");
6283 
6284  /*
6285  * Write the tags into the file.
6286  */
6287  for (i = 0; i < ga.ga_len; ++i)
6288  {
6289  s = ((char_u **)ga.ga_data)[i];
6290  if (STRNCMP(s, "help-tags\t", 10) == 0)
6291  /* help-tags entry was added in formatted form */
6292  fputs((char *)s, fd_tags);
6293  else
6294  {
6295  fprintf(fd_tags, "%s\t/*", s);
6296  for (p1 = s; *p1 != '\t'; ++p1)
6297  {
6298  /* insert backslash before '\\' and '/' */
6299  if (*p1 == '\\' || *p1 == '/')
6300  putc('\\', fd_tags);
6301  putc(*p1, fd_tags);
6302  }
6303  fprintf(fd_tags, "*\n");
6304  }
6305  }
6306  }
6307  if (mix)
6308  got_int = FALSE; /* continue with other languages */
6309 
6310  for (i = 0; i < ga.ga_len; ++i)
6311  vim_free(((char_u **)ga.ga_data)[i]);
6312  ga_clear(&ga);
6313  fclose(fd_tags); /* there is no check for an error... */
6314 }
6315 
6316 /*
6317  * Generate tags in one help directory, taking care of translations.
6318  */
6319  static void
6320 do_helptags(char_u *dirname, int add_help_tags)
6321 {
6322 #ifdef FEAT_MULTI_LANG
6323  int len;
6324  int i, j;
6325  garray_T ga;
6326  char_u lang[2];
6327  char_u ext[5];
6328  char_u fname[8];
6329  int filecount;
6330  char_u **files;
6331 
6332  /* Get a list of all files in the help directory and in subdirectories. */
6333  STRCPY(NameBuff, dirname);
6334  add_pathsep(NameBuff);
6335  STRCAT(NameBuff, "**");
6336  if (gen_expand_wildcards(1, &NameBuff, &filecount, &files,
6337  EW_FILE|EW_SILENT) == FAIL
6338  || filecount == 0)
6339  {
6340  semsg(_("E151: No match: %s"), NameBuff);
6341  return;
6342  }
6343 
6344  /* Go over all files in the directory to find out what languages are
6345  * present. */
6346  ga_init2(&ga, 1, 10);
6347  for (i = 0; i < filecount; ++i)
6348  {
6349  len = (int)STRLEN(files[i]);
6350  if (len > 4)
6351  {
6352  if (STRICMP(files[i] + len - 4, ".txt") == 0)
6353  {
6354  /* ".txt" -> language "en" */
6355  lang[0] = 'e';
6356  lang[1] = 'n';
6357  }
6358  else if (files[i][len - 4] == '.'
6359  && ASCII_ISALPHA(files[i][len - 3])
6360  && ASCII_ISALPHA(files[i][len - 2])
6361  && TOLOWER_ASC(files[i][len - 1]) == 'x')
6362  {
6363  /* ".abx" -> language "ab" */
6364  lang[0] = TOLOWER_ASC(files[i][len - 3]);
6365  lang[1] = TOLOWER_ASC(files[i][len - 2]);
6366  }
6367  else
6368  continue;
6369 
6370  /* Did we find this language already? */
6371  for (j = 0; j < ga.ga_len; j += 2)
6372  if (STRNCMP(lang, ((char_u *)ga.ga_data) + j, 2) == 0)
6373  break;
6374  if (j == ga.ga_len)
6375  {
6376  /* New language, add it. */
6377  if (ga_grow(&ga, 2) == FAIL)
6378  break;
6379  ((char_u *)ga.ga_data)[ga.ga_len++] = lang[0];
6380  ((char_u *)ga.ga_data)[ga.ga_len++] = lang[1];
6381  }
6382  }
6383  }
6384 
6385  /*
6386  * Loop over the found languages to generate a tags file for each one.
6387  */
6388  for (j = 0; j < ga.ga_len; j += 2)
6389  {
6390  STRCPY(fname, "tags-xx");
6391  fname[5] = ((char_u *)ga.ga_data)[j];
6392  fname[6] = ((char_u *)ga.ga_data)[j + 1];
6393  if (fname[5] == 'e' && fname[6] == 'n')
6394  {
6395  /* English is an exception: use ".txt" and "tags". */
6396  fname[4] = NUL;
6397  STRCPY(ext, ".txt");
6398  }
6399  else
6400  {
6401  /* Language "ab" uses ".abx" and "tags-ab". */
6402  STRCPY(ext, ".xxx");
6403  ext[1] = fname[5];
6404  ext[2] = fname[6];
6405  }
6406  helptags_one(dirname, ext, fname, add_help_tags);
6407  }
6408 
6409  ga_clear(&ga);
6410  FreeWild(filecount, files);
6411 
6412 #else
6413  /* No language support, just use "*.txt" and "tags". */
6414  helptags_one(dirname, (char_u *)".txt", (char_u *)"tags", add_help_tags);
6415 #endif
6416 }
6417 
6418  static void
6419 helptags_cb(char_u *fname, void *cookie)
6420 {
6421  do_helptags(fname, *(int *)cookie);
6422 }
6423 
6424 /*
6425  * ":helptags"
6426  */
6427  void
6428 ex_helptags(exarg_T *eap)
6429 {
6430  expand_T xpc;
6431  char_u *dirname;
6432  int add_help_tags = FALSE;
6433 
6434  /* Check for ":helptags ++t {dir}". */
6435  if (STRNCMP(eap->arg, "++t", 3) == 0 && VIM_ISWHITE(eap->arg[3]))
6436  {
6437  add_help_tags = TRUE;
6438  eap->arg = skipwhite(eap->arg + 3);
6439  }
6440 
6441  if (STRCMP(eap->arg, "ALL") == 0)
6442  {
6443  do_in_path(p_rtp, (char_u *)"doc", DIP_ALL + DIP_DIR,
6444  helptags_cb, &add_help_tags);
6445  }
6446  else
6447  {
6448  ExpandInit(&xpc);
6449  xpc.xp_context = EXPAND_DIRECTORIES;
6450  dirname = ExpandOne(&xpc, eap->arg, NULL,
6451  WILD_LIST_NOTFOUND|WILD_SILENT, WILD_EXPAND_FREE);
6452  if (dirname == NULL || !mch_isdir(dirname))
6453  semsg(_("E150: Not a directory: %s"), eap->arg);
6454  else
6455  do_helptags(dirname, add_help_tags);
6456  vim_free(dirname);
6457  }
6458 }
6459 
6460 /*
6461  * Make the user happy.
6462  */
6463  void
6464 ex_smile(exarg_T *eap UNUSED)
6465 {
6466  static char *code[] = {
6467  "\34 \4o\14$\4ox\30 \2o\30$\1ox\25 \2o\36$\1o\11 \1o\1$\3 \2$\1 \1o\1$x\5 \1o\1 \1$\1 \2o\10 \1o\44$\1o\7 \2$\1 \2$\1 \2$\1o\1$x\2 \2o\1 \1$\1 \1$\1 \1\"\1$\6 \1o\11$\4 \15$\4 \11$\1o\7 \3$\1o\2$\1o\1$x\2 \1\"\6$\1o\1$\5 \1o\11$\6 \13$\6 \12$\1o\4 \10$x\4 \7$\4 \13$\6 \13$\6 \27$x\4 \27$\4 \15$\4 \16$\2 \3\"\3$x\5 \1\"\3$\4\"\61$\5 \1\"\3$x\6 \3$\3 \1o\62$\5 \1\"\3$\1ox\5 \1o\2$\1\"\3 \63$\7 \3$\1ox\5 \3$\4 \55$\1\"\1 \1\"\6$",
6468  "\5o\4$\1ox\4 \1o\3$\4o\5$\2 \45$\3 \1o\21$x\4 \10$\1\"\4$\3 \42$\5 \4$\10\"x\3 \4\"\7 \4$\4 \1\"\34$\1\"\6 \1o\3$x\16 \1\"\3$\1o\5 \3\"\22$\1\"\2$\1\"\11 \3$x\20 \3$\1o\12 \1\"\2$\2\"\6$\4\"\13 \1o\3$x\21 \4$\1o\40 \1o\3$\1\"x\22 \1\"\4$\1o\6 \1o\6$\1o\1\"\4$\1o\10 \1o\4$x\24 \1\"\5$\2o\5 \2\"\4$\1o\5$\1o\3 \1o\4$\2\"x\27 \2\"\5$\4o\2 \1\"\3$\1o\11$\3\"x\32 \2\"\7$\2o\1 \12$x\42 \4\"\13$x\46 \14$x\47 \12$\1\"x\50 \1\"\3$\4\"x"
6469  };
6470  char *p;
6471  int n;
6472  int i;
6473 
6474  msg_start();
6475  msg_putchar('\n');
6476  for (i = 0; i < 2; ++i)
6477  for (p = code[i]; *p != NUL; ++p)
6478  if (*p == 'x')
6479  msg_putchar('\n');
6480  else
6481  for (n = *p++; n > 0; --n)
6482  if (*p == 'o' || *p == '$')
6483  msg_putchar_attr(*p, HL_ATTR(HLF_L));
6484  else
6485  msg_putchar(*p);
6486  msg_clr_eos();
6487 }
6488 
6489 /*
6490  * ":drop"
6491  * Opens the first argument in a window. When there are two or more arguments
6492  * the argument list is redefined.
6493  */
6494  void
6495 ex_drop(exarg_T *eap)
6496 {
6497  int split = FALSE;
6498  win_T *wp;
6499  buf_T *buf;
6500  tabpage_T *tp;
6501 
6502  /*
6503  * Check if the first argument is already being edited in a window. If
6504  * so, jump to that window.
6505  * We would actually need to check all arguments, but that's complicated
6506  * and mostly only one file is dropped.
6507  * This also ignores wildcards, since it is very unlikely the user is
6508  * editing a file name with a wildcard character.
6509  */
6510  set_arglist(eap->arg);
6511 
6512  /*
6513  * Expanding wildcards may result in an empty argument list. E.g. when
6514  * editing "foo.pyc" and ".pyc" is in 'wildignore'. Assume that we
6515  * already did an error message for this.
6516  */
6517  if (ARGCOUNT == 0)
6518  return;
6519 
6520  if (cmdmod.tab)
6521  {
6522  /* ":tab drop file ...": open a tab for each argument that isn't
6523  * edited in a window yet. It's like ":tab all" but without closing
6524  * windows or tabs. */
6525  ex_all(eap);
6526  }
6527  else
6528  {
6529  /* ":drop file ...": Edit the first argument. Jump to an existing
6530  * window if possible, edit in current window if the current buffer
6531  * can be abandoned, otherwise open a new window. */
6532  buf = buflist_findnr(ARGLIST[0].ae_fnum);
6533 
6534  FOR_ALL_TAB_WINDOWS(tp, wp)
6535  {
6536  if (wp->w_buffer == buf)
6537  {
6538  goto_tabpage_win(tp, wp);
6539  curwin->w_arg_idx = 0;
6540  return;
6541  }
6542  }
6543 
6544  /*
6545  * Check whether the current buffer is changed. If so, we will need
6546  * to split the current window or data could be lost.
6547  * Skip the check if the 'hidden' option is set, as in this case the
6548  * buffer won't be lost.
6549  */
6550  if (!buf_hide(curbuf))
6551  {
6552  ++emsg_off;
6553  split = check_changed(curbuf, CCGD_AW | CCGD_EXCMD);
6554  --emsg_off;
6555  }
6556 
6557  /* Fake a ":sfirst" or ":first" command edit the first argument. */
6558  if (split)
6559  {
6560  eap->cmdidx = CMD_sfirst;
6561  eap->cmd[0] = 's';
6562  }
6563  else
6564  eap->cmdidx = CMD_first;
6565  ex_rewind(eap);
6566  }
6567 }
6568 
6569 /*
6570  * Skip over the pattern argument of ":vimgrep /pat/[g][j]".
6571  * Put the start of the pattern in "*s", unless "s" is NULL.
6572  * If "flags" is not NULL put the flags in it: VGR_GLOBAL, VGR_NOJUMP.
6573  * If "s" is not NULL terminate the pattern with a NUL.
6574  * Return a pointer to the char just past the pattern plus flags.
6575  */
6576  char_u *
6577 skip_vimgrep_pat(char_u *p, char_u **s, int *flags)
6578 {
6579  int c;
6580 
6581  if (vim_isIDc(*p))
6582  {
6583  /* ":vimgrep pattern fname" */
6584  if (s != NULL)
6585  *s = p;
6586  p = skiptowhite(p);
6587  if (s != NULL && *p != NUL)
6588  *p++ = NUL;
6589  }
6590  else
6591  {
6592  /* ":vimgrep /pattern/[g][j] fname" */
6593  if (s != NULL)
6594  *s = p + 1;
6595  c = *p;
6596  p = skip_regexp(p + 1, c, TRUE, NULL);
6597  if (*p != c)
6598  return NULL;
6599 
6600  /* Truncate the pattern. */
6601  if (s != NULL)
6602  *p = NUL;
6603  ++p;
6604 
6605  /* Find the flags */
6606  while (*p == 'g' || *p == 'j')
6607  {
6608  if (flags != NULL)
6609  {
6610  if (*p == 'g')
6611  *flags |= VGR_GLOBAL;
6612  else
6613  *flags |= VGR_NOJUMP;
6614  }
6615  ++p;
6616  }
6617  }
6618  return p;
6619 }
6620 
6621 #if defined(FEAT_EVAL) || defined(PROTO)
6622 /*
6623  * List v:oldfiles in a nice way.
6624  */
6625  void
6626 ex_oldfiles(exarg_T *eap UNUSED)
6627 {
6628  list_T *l = get_vim_var_list(VV_OLDFILES);
6629  listitem_T *li;
6630  int nr = 0;
6631  char_u *fname;
6632 
6633  if (l == NULL)
6634  msg(_("No old files"));
6635  else
6636  {
6637  msg_start();
6638  msg_scroll = TRUE;
6639  for (li = l->lv_first; li != NULL && !got_int; li = li->li_next)
6640  {
6641  ++nr;
6642  fname = tv_get_string(&li->li_tv);
6643  if (!message_filtered(fname))
6644  {
6645  msg_outnum((long)nr);
6646  msg_puts(": ");
6647  msg_outtrans(fname);
6648  msg_clr_eos();
6649  msg_putchar('\n');
6650  out_flush(); /* output one line at a time */
6651  ui_breakcheck();
6652  }
6653  }
6654 
6655  /* Assume "got_int" was set to truncate the listing. */
6656  got_int = FALSE;
6657 
6658 # ifdef FEAT_BROWSE_CMD
6659  if (cmdmod.browse)
6660  {
6661  quit_more = FALSE;
6662  nr = prompt_for_number(FALSE);
6663  msg_starthere();
6664  if (nr > 0)
6665  {
6666  char_u *p = list_find_str(get_vim_var_list(VV_OLDFILES),
6667  (long)nr);
6668 
6669  if (p != NULL)
6670  {
6671  p = expand_env_save(p);
6672  eap->arg = p;
6673  eap->cmdidx = CMD_edit;
6674  cmdmod.browse = FALSE;
6675  do_exedit(eap, NULL);
6676  vim_free(p);
6677  }
6678  }
6679  }
6680 # endif
6681  }
6682 }
6683 #endif
